  • Proficiency in one or more scripting languages preferred
  • Cumulative GPA of 3.0 and above required
  • Experience with object-oriented programming languages such as (Java, C++ Python, JavaScript, C#, etc.)
  • Knowledge of SQL preferred
  • Excellent problem-solving, communication, teamwork, and analytical skills
  • Strong technical skills (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)

position: Local College Co-op - Emergency Services & Security
description:
Dow has an exciting part-time cooperative education job opportunity available in Midland, MI. This position is open to qualified and highly-committed college students enrolled in a fully accredited college or university located very close to the Midland Dow site. Unlike a short-term internship project outside of school terms, this particular role is a long-term, year-round, undergraduate student position -- at least one full year in duration -- while the student is simultaneously taking classes toward an undergraduate degree. This opportunity offers the student valuable professional work experience in a dynamic, multi-national corporation interfacing with colleagues and leaders in many different roles. This program is designed for academically successful students who meet ALL of the specific job and co-op program requirements listed below and who can simultaneously succeed both in school and in a professional work environment.

   

Job Purpose

This position of a Student Security Officer within the Emergency Services & Security (ES&S) department exists to provide security and process the flow of personnel and materials at the gate locations of the Midland area corporate, manufacturing and research locations.

Key Job Responsibilities

Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Performing vehicle inspections

  • Effective, professional and helpful communication and conduct with employees, customers, suppliers, etc.

  • Enforcement of security procedures

  • Documentation for visitors and materials in and out of Dow facilities

  • Monitoring/operation security and access control systems, security alarms, badge programming/creation, camera operations, and tracking system for shipping of dry and bulk materials.

Required & Preferred Qualifications

  • Must be pursuing an undergrad degree from a fully accredited college or university near the Dow Midland, MI site.

  • A major in criminal justice or fire science is preferred but not required. 

  • During vehicle inspections, the student must be able to climb in and out of vehicles, including semi-trucks.

  • Depending on the shift that is available, there is a potential to work a shift other than a day shift.

  • The student will periodically need to operate a vehicle during their assignment; therefore, a valid driver's license and safe driving is required.

  • During winter months, salting and shoveling the sidewalks are also required.

  • Candidates must have good interpersonal skills.

  • Candidates must be able to multitask during emergency and normal operational situations and have the ability to change priorities as needed.

  • Teamwork and cooperation are essential, as well as taking independent initiative on things that need to be done.

  • Candidates must be knowledgeable with computers and Microsoft applications, especially using Word, Excel and Outlook.

Critical Requirements of the Local Student Co-Op Program

  • High school diploma/GED and already enrolled at an accredited college or university located close to the Midland Dow site, pursuing an undergraduate degree.

  • Successfully complete a minimum of 6 credit hours per term during both the Fall and Winter terms (~Sept-Apr).

  • Seeking high performing student with strong GPAs of 3.000+; however, a minimum 2.700+ term and cumulative GPA on a 4.000 scale is required at ALL times – both to enter and to continue working in the Dow co-op program.  Attach a screen capture from your school’s website or a copy of your most recent transcripts/grade report showing classes and recent GPAs to this application.  Eligibility to continue in this cooperative education program is checked every term.

  • Able to begin work very soon, usually within 3 weeks of the job offer, and work year-round at least 20 hours each week ONLY during our regular business hours (8am-5pm, Mon-Fri…max 8 hours/day and 30/week during school).

  • Commit to the role for at least 1 full calendar year (BEFORE completing classes for your stated undergraduate degree or BEFORE transferring out of the area).  Students available longer than one year before completing their degree program are preferred and advantaged. 

  • Reliable attendance and punctuality in commuting to work daily or at least 3 days a week; therefore, dependable transportation, dedication and time management skills are absolutely required. 

  • Registered/enrolled in their school's Cooperative Education Program before the first day at Dow and comply with the school’s policies/requirements, in addition to Dow's, for the duration of co-op employment. 

  • Any current Dow college co-ops wishing to transfer into this role must have been in their current role at least one full year, must have at least one full year left before graduating or transferring out of the area, and must have supervisor approval before applying to each Dow co-op job posting.

Candidates who receive a job offer will be required to pass a background check and drug screen/medical evaluation and will verify school-related requirements and I-9 documentation before being hired into Dow.

A minimum requirement for this U.S. based position is the ability to work legally in the United States.  No visa sponsorship/support is available for this position, including for any type of U.S. permanent residency (green card) process.

About Dow

 

Dow (NYSE: DOW) combines global breadth, asset integration and scale, focused innovation and leading business positions to achieve profitable growth. The Company’s ambition is to become the most innovative, customer centric, inclusive and sustainable materials science company, with a purpose to deliver a sustainable future for the world through our materials science expertise and collaboration with our partners. Dow’s portfolio of plastics, industrial intermediates, coatings and silicones businesses delivers a broad range of differentiated science-based products and solutions for its customers in high-growth market segments, such as packaging, infrastructure, mobility and consumer care. Dow operates 106 manufacturing sites in 31 countries and employs approximately 35,700 people. Dow delivered sales of approximately $39 billion in 2020. References to Dow or the Company mean Dow Inc. and its subsidiaries. For more information, please visit www.dow.com or follow @DowNewsroom on Twitter.


 As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Dow is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at http://www.dow.com/en-us/contact-us or you may call us at 1-800-523-3945.

NEW BRUNSWICK, NJ

Product Development works with colleagues throughout the entire development process from discovery, all the way to commercial launch. Additionally, PD also manufactures, packages, labels, and distributes all of the clinical supplies for each and every clinical study that our company runs in more than 50 countries. We are looking for candidates who are proven team players; appreciate the challenge of pursuing unique scientific discovery in an emerging field, and who demonstrate solid operational, interpersonal, project management and collaborative skills. We believe this starts with our summer intern program. Co-op will work with a mentor for ~6 months on a guided research project within a PD Project Team. The program is organized to ensure that interns gain valuable industry and functional experience, work on challenging assignments, learn about the Client's and meet company representatives.   • An orientation, including an overview of company structure, products, and brands
  • An introduction to biologics process development and cell line development.
  • Exposure to senior management and business leaders.
  • Formal presentation at the end of your project.
  • A mentor program.
  • Formal review and feedback sessions.

description:
Location: West Conshohocken, PA
Description: Our client is currently seeking a Market Research Manager

 
POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team’s capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI team’s intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying AmerisourceBergen’s guiding principles. In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive. Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
· Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
· Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
· Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
· Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
· Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
· Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
· Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of AmerisourceBergen’s performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
· Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
· With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
· Becomes AmerisourceBergen’s foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team’s goals
· Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
· Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
· Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
· Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
· Manages the intern’s workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern’s professional development.
· Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team’s workflows, processes, and deliverables
· Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
· Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Typical Education
· Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
· Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
· Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
· Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
· Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
· Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
· Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
· Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
· Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
· Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
· Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
· Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
· Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
· Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
· Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
· Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
· Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
· Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
· Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
· Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
· Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
· Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
· Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
· Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
· Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
· Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
· Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
· Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
· Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME’s as required to meet project objectives.

4. What special requirements/skills you would like us to screen for (i.e.: "Must Haves")? See job description as well.
Data analytics skill, statistical modeling skills should be advanced. Intermediate to advanced experience with statistical software (R, SPSS, Qualtrics, Sawtooth etc.)

1. Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

About the team


SAP solutions are the backbone of the most successfully run businesses worldwide: today, more than 50% of the worlds business transactions touch an SAP system. Altogether, they offer a universe of lucrative employment opportunities with increasing demand year after year. Knowing how to develop, market, consult or install SAP allows you to make a huge impact on the way companies do business increasing efficiency, innovating new business models, and creating value. What youll do:


The role of the Project Operations Intern is to support Project Managers in all aspects of the project life cycle including; initiate, plan, executing, monitor and control, and close using our SAP tools and Project Management Methodology.This is an internship position responsible for performing a basic function to support SAP Services delivery execution on customer engagements.


+ Assists with the coordination of project documentation and project creation in our SAP systems

+ Assists with tasks associated with monitoring and controlling the project

+ Assists with collecting estimates to complete work hours and forecasting revenue of a project

+ Assists with analysis of a project to proactively ensure the on-time delivery of a project within budget

+ Assists with maintaining necessary master and transactional data that supports our local and Global project reporting

+ Works with consultants and project managers to ensure accuracy of project reporting

+ Captures project metrics and ensures they are clearly communicated to appropriate SAP or Customer team members

+ Assists with time entry consolidations and billing reconciliations

+ Learns our SAP Tools and Systems

Location: Newtown Square please note that roles will be remote until local guidelines ensure safe office reopenings

SKILLS / COMPETENCIES

position: 2022 Texas Summer Intern – Technology Majors Frisco,
description:
2022 Texas Summer Intern – Technology Majors Frisco, TX


Program Overview:


Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands-on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 6, 2022 – August 12, 2022 and work approximately 40 hours per week.


Job Description:


Fiserv is currently looking for innovative and motivated Technology and Product Interns to participate in the 10-week 2022 Summer Internship Program. Technology areas such as Application Development, Global & Cyber Security, Mobile Solutions, Network Engineering and Quality Assurance are offering internships; each will provide training curriculum, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning.


Interns will work with Technology professionals learning much needed skills such as coding, testing and support application software; work with senior analysts and experienced teammates; offer innovative suggestions; participate in quality inspections; support in ongoing documentation of existing process, with mentorship, and other complicated projects. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment.


Qualifications:


+ Progress towards completion of bachelor's degree by December 2022 / May 2024 with demonstrated academic achievement

+ Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)

+ Interest in learning and using emerging technologies (Mobile, payments, cloud computing, information security, and converging markets

+ Understanding of development processes and life cycles preferred (Waterfall and SCRUM/Agile)

+ Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge

+ Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills

+ Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists)

+ Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship


Desired Technical Qualifications, expertise not required:


+ C#

+ C / C++ Microsoft .NET

+ ASP .NET

+ Java Script

+ Java

+ COBOL

+ JCL

+ Oracle

+ Linux


Majors:


A wide range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, MIS, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math) , but willing to train the right candidate.


Learn more about Fiserv:


To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.


We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.


Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.


We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.


We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.


Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the eighth consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.


We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran


Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us. #FSINT

position: Financial Modeling and Analysis Intern -Express Scripts
description:
If you're looking to use your analytical or software skills in a fast-paced environment, the Financial Modeling & Analysis Department might be the place for you! Express Scripts is known for innovative technology and is looking for a summer intern with a passion for technology, collaboration, and creative problem-solving. The intern will actively contribute to meaningful software projects and work closely with skilled software developers and with senior leadership. Our growth-oriented company is dedicated to providing you with valuable learning opportunities, such as having the chance to learn functional use of tools like Excel, VBA, SQL, Oracle, Jira, and Confluence.

What you'll do:

Cigna's 10 - 12 week summer internship program is designed to help further develop your analytical skills and business acumen in a dynamic work environment. This opportunity will give you the chance to be a part of the following offerings:

  • "Real" work through an Intern Project: You will be assigned a software project supporting internal process engineering efforts I which you may help to:
    • Develop software applications (VBA, SQL, Oracle, and/or Confluence)
    • Convert the requirements of project plans into code
    • Analyze requirements to identify optimal execution strategies
    • Document and test new software applications
    • Present your Intern Project
  • Community: you will have the opportunity for Shadowing, mentoring, and training opportunities with seasoned software development professionals within our organization!
  • Leader Speaker Series: you and your fellow interns will be exposed to a variety of lectures and presentations given by members of the Cigna community.
  • Compensation: earn a highly competitive hourly rate in addition to gaining valuable work experience.

What you need to do the job:

  • Ideal candidate will be progressing toward a bachelor's degree; preferred majors/minors include Computer Science, IT, Finance, Business Administration, Economics, Actuarial Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field
  • 3.0 GPA or higher is preferred
  • Proficiency with Microsoft office software, Microsoft Excel is required
  • Experience programming in Visual Basic (VBA) is required
  • Working knowledge in SQL, Oracle, Jira, and Confluence is a plus
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills
  • Strong business aptitude
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Additional Information:

  • Location:St. Louis, MO. This role can work from home however, geographical preference is for the incumbent to be located in St. Louis area. The internship is paid and housing assistance is not offered.
  • Work Authorization: One goal of this internship program is to prepare and identify qualified candidates for roles with Cigna post-graduation. Therefore, this temporary internship is open only to individuals who are eligible for employment in the United States and who would not require visa sponsorship now or in the future.
  • Schedule: You must be available to work a 40-hour work week for 10-12 weeks in summer 2022, beginning May 23, 2022.

This position is not eligible to be performed in Colorado.

About Cigna

Cigna Corporation exists to improve lives. We are a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. Together, with colleagues around the world, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation. When you work with us, or one of our subsidiaries, you'll enjoy meaningful career experiences that enrich people's lives. What difference will you make?

Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex, childbirth (including pregnancy) or related medical conditions including but not limited to lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital or familial status, genetic information, status with regard to public assistance, citizenship status or any other characteristic protected by applicable equal employment opportunity laws.

If you require reasonable accommodation in completing the online application process, please email: SeeYourself@cigna.com for support. Do not email SeeYourself@cigna.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

Your Opportunity

Are you looking for an opportunity to use your passion for programming and development? Do you want to work on a collaborative team to solve challenging engineering problems?

As a Software Engineering Intern at New Relic, you'll join our Product organization for a full-time, paid 12-week summer internship beginning in either May or June 2022! You’ll work on real-world projects that will make an impact on our business, and develop practical skills to apply throughout your career. Over the summer, we'll have the opportunity for you to:

  • Attend chats with current employees to learn more about their roles, receive advice, and begin to build your network
  • Work with a dedicated mentor through our formalized and flexible mentorship program
  • Gain useful skills through professional development trainings and informative feedback
  • Connect with the intern community through meetings, projects, and social events
  • Learn about the company and our vision to instrument, measure, and improve software
  • Showcase your work via a final presentation to management

What You’ll Do

As part of the engineering team, you may focus on back-end, front-end, DevOps, or Full Stack work. Some of the projects may include:

  • Building product components for New Relic’s customers by creating high-throughput backend services and flexible, easy-to-use front-end components
  • Participating in daily team processes and learn all aspects of the software development lifecycle
  • Working with engineers to build, maintain, and scale services
  • Writing and deploying code while using software in new technologies
  • Using modern software deployment pipelines
  • Ensuring all code meets testing, scalability, and reliability requirements
  • Understanding and articulating how your work delivers value to our customers

Your Qualifications

Must-have:

  • Currently enrolled in an undergraduate Bachelor's program, and will be a rising senior graduating between December 2022 - June 2023
  • A foundation in computer science theory, with strong proficiencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design
  • Experience in our commonly used languages: Java, Ruby, Python, JavaScript, Go, or comparable high-level programming languages

Nice-to-have:

  • Degree focus in Computer Science or related fields
  • Familiarity with one or more of the following: Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, AWS, React, Git
  • Participation in university clubs Examples - SWE, WiCS, SHPE, NSBE, ACM, Hacker teams, or any others focusing on the professional development of your computer science skills
  • Leadership experience in clubs or on projects

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to create more perfect software. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.

About Us

New Relic (NYSE: NEWR) is a cloud-based observability platform that gives developers, engineers, operations, and management a clear view of what’s happening in today’s complex software environments. So they can find and fix problems faster, and deliver delightful experiences for their customers. That's why the world’s best engineering teams rely on New Relic to visualize, analyze, and troubleshoot their software. It’s the simplest, most powerful cloud-based observability platform, built to create more perfect software. All from one place.

Founded in 2008, we’re a global company passionate about building a culture where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging, where every ‘Relic’ can bring their whole self to work and feel supported and empowered to thrive. We’re consistently recognized as a distinguished employer and are committed to building world-class products and an award-winning culture. For more information, visit newrelic.com.

Habitat for Humanity Wake County is currently seeking a talented professional for the Directory of Advocacy position.
Reporting to the President/CEO, the Director of Advocacy is responsible for leading the affiliate’s advocacy efforts by promoting policies and systems that eliminate barriers to affordable housing. The Director of Advocacy will lead the department in conducting public education and awareness activities to highlight the importance of housing affordability in our community and build political will for change.

Policy advocacy and governmental affairs:

Provide leadership in setting and implementing Habitat Wake’s advocacy agenda, policy priorities, and strategy.
Lead Habitat Wake’s policy advocacy efforts, which are primarily focused at the local/regional level with some engagement at state and national levels in collaboration with Habitat North Carolina and Habitat for Humanity International.
Champion Habitat Wake’s participation in HFHI’s Cost of Home national advocacy campaign.
Guide Habitat Wake’s involvement in Habitat NC’s and Habitat for Humanity International (HFHI)’s state, national and global housing policy efforts.
Build and maintain strong relationships with local, state, and national policymakers to position Habitat Wake as a trusted advisor on housing issues.
Support the development review processes for Habitat Wake projects and mobilize the network to contact elected officials in support when needed.

Public awareness and education:

Speak on behalf of Habitat Wake to promote its advocacy agenda in collaboration with the CEO.
Raise awareness for equitable housing policies and call out systems that perpetuate the need for Habitat, especially through a racial justice lens.
Partner with the Communications department to set advocacy communications strategy, including key messaging, media, public relations, and online engagement.
Position Habitat Wake as a thought leader and resource on affordable housing, especially regarding homeownership
Educate policymakers and community leaders on housing policy and issues affecting Habitat Wake’s ability to further its mission.

Community partnerships:

Forge partnerships with organizations across the housing continuum so that all may work together to advance access to housing affordability.
Provide leadership for Wake Affordable Housing Coalition (WAHC) in its efforts to promote local housing solutions through a shared agenda.

Grassroots mobilizing:

Lead efforts to engage Habitat Wake’s constituency with housing advocacy messages and present opportunities for stakeholders to take action.
Facilitate Habitat Wake’s involvement in network-wide advocacy events, including Habitat NC Legislative Day, Habitat NC Week of Action, Habitat on the Hill, World Habitat Day, etc.
Recruit board members, advocacy committee and homebuyers to participate in HFHI’s national lobby day, Habitat on the Hill.
Work with the Homeownership Services team to empower homebuyers and neighborhood residents to become housing advocates.
Partner with the Faith Relations department to engage faith coalitions in advocacy from a faith-based justice perspective

Research and analysis:

Oversee research activities to provide analysis that supports the public awareness and policy objectives of the organization.

Strategic planning and departmental leadership:

Set the strategy for Habitat Wake’s advocacy initiatives in collaboration with the Advocacy Committee and CEO.
Represent the advocacy function on Habitat Wake’s senior leadership team.
Supervise the Advocacy Coordinator role and other staff/intern/volunteer positions within the department.
Manage department budget and track expenditures.
Report advocacy metrics and progress on a monthly basis.
Develop monthly reports for the Advocacy Committee and Board of Directors.
Engage in strategic planning to set annual objectives within the context of Habitat Wake’s organizational goals.

Advocacy Committee:

Lead the Advocacy Committee in shaping Habitat Wake’s advocacy agenda and setting annual policy priorities that guide the affiliates advocacy work.
Recruit for the Advocacy Committee and onboard new members.
Work with the Advocacy Committee chair to set meeting agendas.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:

5+ years of experience in advocacy, government relations, public affairs and/or awareness campaigns aimed at influencing policy change.
Knowledge of affordable housing issues and policy at the local, state and/or national level
Experience developing and managing efforts to influence policymakers and external stakeholders.
Ability to think strategically and use judgement in decision-making.
Prioritize work to meet objectives when balancing multiple projects with differing deadlines, importance, and stakeholders.
Strong relational, analytical, writing, and verbal skills for communicating with diverse populations.
Ability to establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with Habitat Wake staff, Advocacy Committee, community partners, and policymakers.
Ability to organize work and time while working efficiently and effectively in an office with frequent interruptions.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team and with great energy and persistence.
Excellent public relations skills with a passion for the organization’s mission.
Critical thinking, problem solving, accuracy and attention to detail.
Experience effectively managing a team.
Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite, Office 365, and virtual meeting platforms, Asana project management software.
Familiarity with data sets such as U.S. Census, Comprehensive Housing Affordability Strategy (CHAS), HUD Income Limits, HUD Fair Market Rents (FMR) preferred.
Willingness to pursue ongoing training (e.g. affordable housing & advocacy) and professional development.
Bachelor’s degree in political science, public affairs, public policy, communications, or related field; Master’s degree preferred.

Intern, Manufacturing Engineer
Eatontown-NJ-US


Founded in 1934 by aviation innovator Sir Alan Cobham, our values of Trust, Talent and Technology have driven us to become a global leader in state-of-the-art aerospace and defense systems. It's the insights of our innovators today that will secure our collective future. Innovators like you!

Cobham is actively seeking a Intern, Manufacturing Engineer. Under tutelage of Senior Manufacturing Engineer works closely with Operations to ensure all processes, equipment and supporting systems operate to their maximum effectiveness, within specified safety and cost constraints, and that all products are of the desired quality; performs evaluations and analysis of process related issues of intermediate complexity in electronic systems and assemblies; determines and implements corrective actions to improve processes; performs work of intermediate complexity.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS and DUTIES:

Maintain methods, operation sequence and optimize processes in the manufacture or fabrication of parts, components, sub-assemblies and final assemblies.
Create all aspects of development, documentation and production support from concept through sustaining activities. May include development and validation of test data sheets, ATP's, QTP's.
Expand and implement concepts, including Lean Manufacturing, etc., to reduce manufacturing cost and increase process throughput; evaluate new materials and supplies in use based on project scope.
Collaborate with all levels of engineering and drafting staff in the development of new ideas; reviews current documentation and develop Engineering change Orders (ECO) as required.
Prepare reports, publishes and makes presentations to communicate findings.
Ensure compliance to design contract specification and schedule.
Participate in safety training and comply with safety policies and practices.
Collaborate in team meetings and LEAN activities.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
Applies manufacturing principles and practices to specific processes; re-writes processes to correct errors or maximize manufacturing efficiencies;
Performs work of intermediate complexity.
Hands on engagement with assembly and test operators improving effectiveness and efficiency of manufacturing processes and test protocols.


Basic Qualifications:

  • Actively in process of attaining a Bachelor of Science degree in Manufacturing Engineering, Manufacturing Technology, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related discipline

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Communication skills: ability to receive messages by telephone, in person, electronically and in writing; ask questions and rephrase statements to clarify meaning; ability to read, interpret and comprehend complex written technical publications; communicate across organizational levels; ability to communicate with quality, integrity and respect in a way that inspires others and encourages innovation and possibilities.
  • Computer skills:working in a networked environment using a Windows and/or Windows like interface using Power Point, Excel and Word software programs at an advance level; Labview programming a plus
  • Math & Analytical skills: advanced mathematical skills, including statistical analysis; review and compare data to identify inconsistencies and determine priorities; ability to collect, analyze and summarize information to a general understanding; ability to think abstractly and separate complex ideas into simple elements.
  • Time Management and Organizational skills: flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and assignments; ability to maintain confidentiality; work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information.
  • Excellence Behaviors:remain engaged, proactive and positive even in tough circumstances; own assignments and be fully accountable for their success; align actions, behaviors and conversations to what matters most; ability to work independently and as a team member.


If you are authorized to work in the United States, then we encourage you to apply. We are unable to sponsor work visas. In order to be eligible for positions requiring a Security Clearance, you must be a US Citizen.

Cobham is one of the world's leading companies engaged in the development, delivery and support of leading-edge aerospace and defense systems in the air, on land and at sea. Our clients and partners trust Cobham to deliver the mission-critical technology they need, and we trust our employees to draw on their ingenuity and passion to deliver those solutions. This leads to an empowering culture for our people. Our Leadership team is open, sharing plans for the next five years, driving retention by offering demanding, exciting work, and providing full guidance and mentoring.

description:
What we offer


Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAPs global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP

1. Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

2. Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.

3. Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, youll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs, and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team


The Platform Adoption & Advisory team works with SAP customers to help them adopt the Business Technology Platform. Were a global team, comprised of designers, engineers, data scientists, and business experts, working primarily from Palo Alto and Germany, though we have a few colleagues in other locations as well! We build a proof of concepts on the BTP and turn the best ones into repeatable use cases for all of our customers.


What youll do:


Position title: SAP iXp Intern- BTP Use Case Factory Software Developer

Location : Virtual, USA

Expected start date: September 2021 (6 Months)


In this role, youll:


Be part of the Use Case Factory, a transformative initiative to bring repeatable BTP use cases to customers, partners, and SAP colleagues

Contribute code samples for BTP integration, extension, and data to value capabilities and publish the results to GitHub where customers can consume them

Interact with customers and partners to receive feedback on existing use cases and propose improvements

Learn about other SAP cloud solutions and how the BTP brings value to them


Who you are:


Were looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


Ability to work independently on project-related tasks such as defining requirements, writing and checking in code, and creating documentation

Interest in speaking with customers, partners, and other SAP teams to identify the next generation of BTP use cases

Bachelors degree in computer science field or equivalent experience

Knowledge of one or more development languages such as Python, NodeJS, etc.

Familiarity with cloud-native runtimes such as Cloud Foundry and Kubernetes

Experience with hyper scale infrastructure and services such as AWS, GCP, and Azure a plus


We are SAP


SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.


Our inclusion promise


SAPs culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone regardless of background feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.


SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com , APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com , EMEA: Careers@sap.com .


EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

position: Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) Associate Intern (June 2022- May 2023)
description:
At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.


Position Summary


​​​​ ​As a Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) Associate Intern on the Corporate IT Digital Plant MES team, you will be a key contributor to the design, development, maintenance, and support of a common library of objects and recipes that are utilized by manufacturing plants worldwide and support the continued evolution of tools and capabilities for improved end-user experience.


You will work with management, engineering, manufacturing, vendors, and IT resources from ERP/LIMS/CMMS and other systems to deliver enhancements to the MES platform. You will also have an opportunity to work with a variety of technologies such as C#/VB.NET, VBScript, SQL Server, HTML/CSS, OPC, HMI, barcode scanners, and RFID.


Key Responsibilities


+ ​ Work with site functional teams including manufacturing, technology, engineering, and quality to gather user requirements for changes and enhancements

+ Convert user requirements into process and system requirements and build solutions to these specifications

+ Support development and troubleshooting of MES recipes and other components that support manufacturing operations.

+ Understand and track customer complaints and technical issues, the progress of vendor inquiries, and work through issues to resolution

+ Develop and maintain training resources, guides and other material

+ Develop and execute manual unit test suites as well as perform unit and integration testing

+ Review and provide detailed feedback on peer design and source code


What You Will Learn


The MES Associate internship position will allow the intern to learn and develop on the various technologies that go into building, supporting, and maintaining BMS's Enterprise MES solution. This can include building recipe objects with Syncade Recipe Authoring (RA), coding RA behaviors utilizing VBScript, using HTML/CSS to build user displays or batch reports, utilizing SQL to obtain data to support site queries, unit or system testing to validate any current MES objects, or working with the manufacturing sites to build out recipes for their processes, and the list goes on. Because of the many facets of MES, this position would support intern development by allowing the intern to learn and develop on the skills that interest them.


Qualifications and Experience


+ ​ Working towards a bachelor’s in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or similar

+ HTML/CSS, C#, VBScript, SQL, XML/XPath experience appreciated

+ Jira/Confluence experience appreciated

+ Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) is a must


Additional Requirements :


+ Candidates must be available for an internship that will run from June 2022- May 2023

+ Candidates must be available to be able to commute to the BMS- Tampa, FL location for the year internship (Up to 40 hours per week in summer and up to 20 hours per week in fall & spring)

+ Candidates must be actively enrolled in school during the internship with a graduation date of May 2023 or later


Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.


Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

We are currently seeking a Server Repair Intern to support Linode's cloud infrastructure. You will focus on timely troubleshooting, repair, and redeployment of servers, networking equipment, and related infrastructure that isn't functioning as intended. You will support Linode's complete global infrastructure fleet, both physically and virtually. Most importantly, you will be a key component to the Linode Hardware Engineering Team in supporting our hardware, documentation, maintaining inventories, and shipping/receiving.

You will be a natural problem solver and someone who is able to quickly make repairs without costing unnecessary downtime. Impeccable communication skills along with the technical skills to do the job are a must. You will be passionate about IT, quick to grasp new concepts, and have a strong desire to help others. In addition, you will thrive in a high-energy environment where you must solve problems and perform work that is routinely done with minimal direct supervision. 

This position will report to Linode's Hardware Operations Manager. This Internship requires a physical presence in one of our Philadelphia locations.   

Primary Responsibilities

  • Perform onsite server repairs.
  • Troubleshoot, plan, and execute repairs
  • Work with data center personnel to coordinate shipping and receiving
  • Maintain vendor contacts for RMAs, warranty claims, replacement parts, etc. 
  • Manage the process of placing repaired equipment back online
  • Manage inventory levels for production and retired servers as well as repair parts and components
  • Document best practices, repairs, and other workflows as assigned; maintain all existing relevant documentation

Job Requirements

  • Strong understanding of computer hardware and components
  • Ability to speak with Managers, technical/non-technical people, and datacenter contacts. 
  • Strong ability to research, plan, and execute necessary repairs 
  • Ability to work in our Philadelphia, PA location

Preferred Qualifications

  • Coursework in computer science or related technology discipline; certifications, associates degree, or other degree are a bonus 
  • Experience working in a NOC environment or other computer/server repair environment with hands-on hardware experience
  • A+ or similar certification preferred

Work With Us

  • Headquartered in one of the coolest buildings in Philadelphia, Linode has plenty of inviting office space to work from, plus remote work options for most positions.
  • Work/Life Balance: We have flexible work hours, remote work options, and a very generous paid time off package including volunteer time off and even a paid day off on your birthday!
  • Your health matters: We cover up to 90% of medical premiums plus pay for 100% of out of pocket costs that insurance doesn't take care of.
  • Retirement benefits: Linode provides a range of retirement benefits including contributions to your 401k plan, a generous profit sharing plan, and a pension plan. 
  • Your family is important to us! Employees may benefit from fully paid parental leave, company sponsored 529(c) savings plans, and family-friendly company events. 
  • Our benefits to support your wellbeing include fully paid access to online mental wellness programs through AbleTo for you and your family, $100 monthly wellness reimbursements, as well as a robust EAP (employee assistance plan) offering
  • Free hosting service: Take advantage of some Linode service - we'll pick up the tab.
  • Competitive salary: It all begins with fair compensation. We believe in paying people well and rewarding those who go the extra mile. The compensation range for this position is between $20/hour to $25/hour based on a full-time schedule.  The salary could vary outside of this range based on your specific skills and experience. Employees may also qualify for a bonus on top of base salary depending on company and individual performance. 
  • Take a look at our careers site for a full listing of benefits: https://www.linode.com/company/careers/benefits/

Equal Employment, Equal Treatment, No Judgment

Linode is committed to a culture that creates a sense of inclusion and belonging. We understand that teams perform their best when they include people with diverse backgrounds and differing perspectives, but also that to achieve greatness, people need to feel like they can be themselves; they need to be equal, included, and comfortable in order to perform at their best. Linode stands for equal pay, equal treatment, and equal experiences for all of our people, past, present, and future, regardless of age, race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexuality, socioeconomic class, disability status, or any other differentiating factor. We strive to make sure every last person we interact with feels like they belong and has the same opportunities as everyone else.

About Linode

Since 2003, Linode has been providing cloud computing services to customers around the world. Linode offers compute, storage, and networking services from ten data centers in regions spanning North America, Europe, Asia, and Oceania. We are committed to making Linode the most simple, powerful, and reliable hosting provider that thousands of customers—from the fastest-growing startups to established enterprises—trust. This industry moves fast, but we strive to hire the kind of people who can stay a step ahead and keep us - and themselves - at the top. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming workplace for all.

Why Valmont
 

Welcome to Valmont, where a world of opportunity awaits. When you join our team, you become part of a passionate group dedicated to changing lives and conserving resources around the globe. A Brief Summary of This Position:

The E-Learning Instructional Design Intern will work directly with our Global Learning team, creating various types of learning resources for Valmont customers, dealers, agents, and employees. The Intern will partner with subject matter experts to analyze learning needs and develop effective training materials that drive key business objectives. The incumbent will discover how a Learning Management System (LMS) is used to drive employee development in a corporate setting. In addition, they will gain experience in general LMS administration, including online course publishing, end-user technical support and basic reporting. 

Essential Functions:

  • This position reports into the Manager of Global Learning and has no direct reports
  • This role does not require travel (internationally/domestically), or overnight stays
  • Partner with subject matter experts to analyze the training needs of Valley Irrigation dealers, customers, and employees
  • Utilize adult learning principles and instructional strategies to design impactful training programs
  • Develop a variety of training materials including eLearning courses, instructor-led training workshops, tutorial videos, and other multimedia resources
  • Provide project management and design support to other E-Learning Instructional Designers
  • Review, test, and implement online training resources in the Valmont LMS
  • Provide technical support to end-users of the Valmont LMS

Other Important Details about the Role:

  • Strong project management skills, including prioritizing work to meet deadlines
  • Strong critical thinking skills with the ability to overcome complex challenges
  • Ability to use eLearning course authoring tools including Articulate 360
  • Ability to learn video and audio production methods techniques, software and equipment
  • Ability to learn graphic design methods, techniques, software and equipment
  • Ability to think creatively to make learning resources understandable, interactive and engaging
  • Ability to execute basic administrative and reporting tasks in the Valmont LMS

Required Qualifications of Every Candidate (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities):

  • Junior or Senior pursuing an Associate or Bachelor’s degree in Instructional Design, Journalism, Graphic Design, Digital Marketing, Education, Computer Science or Web Design
  • A minimum of 3.0 GPA
  • Previous experience or coursework in one or more of the following areas:  instructional design, graphic design, multimedia production, training facilitation, or digital marketing
  • Experience using digital video and audio production equipment
  • Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Excel, Word and Outlook)
  • Excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Fluent in Spanish (written and verbal) with ability to translate and narrate accurately

Highly Qualified Candidates Will Also Possess These Qualifications:

  • Proven experience delivering face-to-face training
  • Proven experience with Adobe Audition, Premiere, After Effects, InDesign, Photoshop, and Camtasia
  • Fluency in Portuguese, French, Russian, and/or Arabic

Working Environment and Physical Efforts:

Work is typically performed in an office setting.  The incumbent is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time, as well as talk and listen on the phone and in personal conversations or meetings.    The environment is fast-paced and demanding most of the time.  No travel requirements for this position.  The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms while working in the office with various files and forms and while working on the computer.  The employee is occasionally required to move about the office.  Incumbent must utilize proper ergonomic safeguards such as monitor height and positions, keyboard location and height and proper wrists rests. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds in working with large files, binders, and computer equipment.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and depth perception.

KPS Global (KPSG) is the North American industry leader in the manufacture, production, and installation of Walk-in Coolers and Freezers. KPSG’s end-product serves many channels within the retail food market as well as industrial applications. KPSG is based in Fort Worth, Texas with Engineering activities centralized in the Fort Worth facility (along with Finance, Human Resources, Customer Operations, Sales, and Installation Services), supporting product manufacturing in three locations: Fort Worth; Piney Flats, TN; and Goodyear, AZ.

KPS Global values its outstanding people who are deeply committed to providing innovative, high-quality service to clients from coast-to-coast. As a member of the KPS team, you’ll be part of an exciting and modern company culture where you will enjoy professional flexibility and benefit from an environment where creativity, innovation, and hard work are rewarded.

KPS Global is looking for a Commercial Team Analyst to join the Sales Group.

The Commercial Team Analyst interprets customer, sales, and market data from a range of sources and communicates these findings to sales management and team members. The Analyst manages customer data, recognizes trends and key indicators to generate recommendations and solutions. The Analyst works daily to support the CCO Sales & Marketing and team members to make data driven business decisions. The Analyst understands the expectations of the sales team and seeks to facilitate excellent internal customer service.



Required Skills
  • This position will assist in duties including, but not limited to, the following: • Design, develop, test and implement BI solutions and platforms including but not limited to real-time data visualizations, interactive reports and custom ad-hoc reporting.
  • Collaborate with multiple IT teams, including but not limited to the application, data engineering and business intelligence teams to understand and pull data points for reporting purposes.
  • Adhere to recurring sales reporting schedule while balancing project work through effective communication with the team.
  • Demonstrate intellectual curiosity through the creation of new, actionable reporting for the Sales team.
  • Support business decision making with sound analytics and communication.
  • Demonstrate active listening skills, and the ability to understand reporting requirements for new projects.
  • Ability to build scalable solutions essential to decision-making across the organization.
  • Support Sales team with customer-specific analytics for business reviews.
  • Maintain and modify stored queries for the suite of sales reporting.
  • Supply custom reports through platforms such as: PowerBi, SQLServer, and Excel.
  • Prepare documentation and support to stakeholders as needed on various reporting projects.
  • Demonstrate and document best practices for data validation and error resolution.

Software / Programming Language Knowledge

  • Familiar with data visualization software (PowerBi preferred)
  • Proficient in MS Excel (Data visualization, PivotTables, and PowerQuery)
  • Good understanding of SQL to support report creation (Tables and Views)


Required Experience
  • Must be a recent graduate or student currently pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science / Statistics / Information Systems
  • One or two years of experience in any BI Tool preferred

Abilities and Qualifications

  • Proven ability to prioritize workload, meet deadlines, and communicate with stakeholders.
  • Strong statistical, qualitative, and quantitative skills.
  • Data validation protocols
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently.
  • Ability to learn new systems quickly.

About the Role: 

As a security analyst intern at Pondurance you will work side by side (well, virtually these days) with other  analysts to monitor, evaluate and report on clients’ network traffic in an effort to mitigate their risk of attack, as well as immediately contain threats that do penetrate their defenses. 

We will provide you with a brief, structured training period, so you will have all of the tools, knowledge and skills required to operate as a security analyst. During your 10-week internship you will be exposed to various roles in order to provide you with additional experiences and learning opportunities.

Responsibilities:

  • Monitor and analyze large amounts of network traffic looking for attacker presence
  • Triage alerts and incidents for client networks
  • Triage emails for potential phishing threats
  • Identify threat vulnerabilities
  • Document and escalate incidents
  • Use cyber defense tools for continual monitoring and analysis of system activity to identify malicious activity
  • Assist in building weekly threat reports to clients

Technologies: 

  • Experience with open source log or SIEM solutions 
  • Experience with Windows OS
  • Knowledge of information security network devices, and monitoring tools
  • Experience  with query language 
  • Familiar  with ticketing systems 

Knowledge and Skills: 

  • Strong technical and analytical skills
  • Ideal candidate will hold a degree, or is pursuing a degree, in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a related technical discipline and/or will possess equivalent experience
  • Highly organized, able to multitask
  • Must be capable of working individually, within a team, and with other groups
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

If you have other combinations of relevant skills and experience that you expect make you the right candidate for this role, please let us know

Who we are:

At Pondurance we embrace, educate, and protect people by helping make our world a better and safer place.  We believe in inviting good people into our company who are driven to become great!  

Every person at Pondurance is encouraged to focus and grow in their individual areas of interest, passion, and career path. We have accessible leaders as Mentors who believe “None of us are as smart as all of us” (R. Pelletier). 

We believe everyone has the freedom to be themselves, especially at work and so we embrace, support, and celebrate each other. Each one of us influences our company’s direction through speaking up, you have a voice and we want you to use it.  

Do you want to be a part of something different? Do you want to influence real change? Do you want to be part of the solution? Then join us in redefining the security and cyber risk landscape.

What We Offer:

The opportunity to apply your expertise, take on new challenges, and help customers address their biggest security objectives.

An inclusive culture of teamwork that embraces the diversity of our people and communities in which we work.

Some of the corporate benefits (there are more) for full-time employees include:

  • Medical, dental, vision, disability, FSA, HSA, life and AD&D insurance, 401(k) Plan. 
  • Time off: PTO, sick, holiday, & parental leave details are available
  • Money: We provide competitive compensation packages based on the market and your overall credentials.

You will likely be based out of one of our current locations: District of Columbia (DC), Maryland (MD), Virginia (VA), Indiana (IN), Florida (FL), and Texas (TX).

 

To promote a healthy and safe work community we require background and drug screenings as part of our hiring process. Details of our process will be provided upon request.  

We are an equal opportunity employer focused on celebrating diversity and inclusion. We believe that each individual should be treated equally without regard to race, color, identity, national origin, protected veteran status, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

At Equitable, our power is in our people.

We're individuals from different cultures and backgrounds. Those differences make us stronger as a team and a force for good in our communities.

Here, you'll work with dynamic individuals, build your skills, and unleash new ways of working and thinking. Are you ready to join an organization that will help unlock your potential?

Actuarial Intern Program

Each summer, Equitable invites a select group of diverse and talented college students to spend ten weeks learning from our actuarial team. In addition to leading an actuarial project, you will:
  • Prepare for a Society of Actuaries exam with our prep classes.
  • Improve your technical skills through Excel and VBA trainings.
  • Research and collaborate on an actuarial topic that you will present to the senior leadership team.
  • Work with a mentor to enhance your knowledge and learn how to work in an office setting.
  • Learn from experienced actuaries at the Summer Speaker Series.
  • Socialize with developing actuaries and more senior members at various group events throughout the summer.

For over 35 years, our program has provided summer interns with an in-depth look at a challenging and exciting actuarial career. Combining on-the-job training with structured learning opportunities, you will receive personal attention and guidance to make meaningful contributions to current company initiatives. You will gain first-hand experience with the techniques used to solve insurance business problems by working closely with actuaries across the Pricing, Valuation, Actuarial Modeling and Risk Management areas.

Internship Dates: June 6, 2022 through August 12, 2022
Location of internship: Jersey City, NJ or Charlotte, NCSkills required to ensure your success include:
  • Problem Solving: Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems; ability to apply knowledge of problem solving appropriately to in a wide variety of situations.
  • Teamwork: Belief in the necessity and value of teamwork; experience working cooperatively towards shared goals and being supportive of others at all levels.
  • Communication: Understanding the importance of insightful listening and communicating along with the ability to provide information and messages in a way that produces clarity and impact.
  • Planning and Organizing: Knowledge of the process of planning and arranging tasks and resources; ability to plan and organize both time and resources to get things completed while structuring and maintaining work in a systematic and highly methodical way.
  • Continuous Learning: Understanding of the rationale behind the necessity to continually learn and grow and the ability to seek performance feedback and identify approaches to improve own performance and that of others.
  • Results Orientation: Knowledge of the importance of meeting or exceeding established targets; ability to drive critical activities to completion.
  • Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: Demonstrates a commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion by treating everyone with respect and dignity, ensuring all voices are heard and advocating or change.


Other Qualifications:
Minimum Requirements
  • Currently attending/enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program
  • Passing of one actuarial exam OR a score of at least 700 on the Math SAT OR the following educational requirement:
    • Must have at least a 3.7 grade in two classes of the following topics (or similar topics):
      • Probability
      • Statistics
      • Financial Math (Interest Theory, Econometrics, Quantitative Analysis, Financial Theory)
      • Financial Economics
      • Calculus (2-3, Differential Equations)
      • Linear Algebra
      • Computer Science
      • Microeconomics/Macroeconomics
      • Finance
      • Actuarial Mathematics

Note for the above grade requirement, you need to achieve >= 3.7 in each class, not an average between the two.
  • With these two classes, at least one must be a 300-level course, and none can be a 100-level course (so no beginner/introductory classes).
  • At least 1 of the classes must be within the math department (so for example, could not send in 1 economics class and 1 computer science class).

Preferred Requirements
  • Rising senior in undergraduate/graduate program
  • Coursework that includes math, probability and statistics, computer science or economics
  • Ability to think creatively, communicate clearly and work collaboratively

Your Opportunity

Are you looking for an opportunity to use your passion for programming and development? Do you want to work on a collaborative team to solve challenging engineering problems?

What You’ll Do

  • Building product components for New Relic’s customers by creating high-throughput backend services and flexible, easy-to-use front-end components
  • Participating in daily team processes and learn all aspects of the software development lifecycle

  • Writing and deploying code while using software in new technologies

Your Qualifications

Must-have:

  • Currently enrolled in an undergraduate Bachelor's program, and will be a rising senior graduating between December 2022 - June 2023
  • A foundation in computer science theory, with strong proficiencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design
  • Experience in our commonly used languages: Java, Ruby, Python, JavaScript, Go, or comparable high-level programming languages

Nice-to-have:

  • Degree focus in Computer Science or related fields
  • Familiarity with one or more of the following: Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, AWS, React, Git
  • Participation in university clubs Examples - SWE, WiCS, SHPE, NSBE, ACM, Hacker teams, or any others focusing on the professional development of your computer science skills
  • Leadership experience in clubs or on projects

position: Rapid Prototyping for AR Audio Intern
description:
Overview:

SUMMER 2022

 

Shure offers a challenging and rewarding summer internship program. The twelve week program is offered to undergraduate students that have completed at least 2 years of college, as well as graduate students. Each intern will receive a competitive salary and students who reside out of Illinois will receive a housing stipend to cover living expenses for hyrbid or onsite internships. Applications will be collected, reviewed and selected candidates will be contacted in late fall/early winter.

 

The Strategic Technology Team is looking for a rapid prototyping engineer to help research, prototype, and demonstrate forward-leaning use cases with next generation technologies for future product opportunities.

 

As intern for Rapid Prototyping for AR Audio, you will work on projects that relate to the audio side of Augmented Reality. Goal for this internship is to create fully functional prototypes to augment human hearing through advanced ML techniques.

The augmentation of human perception we have seen recently has mostly been in the visual domain with head mounted displays, augmented reality and virtual reality hardware and applications. However, the same principles of AR can be applied to the auditory domain: being able to selectively increase or decrease the volume of certain sound events and sound classes will augment our hearing dramatically. This internship also explores interaction methods for such systems, such as gesture, eye gaze, and conversational agents.

 

We are a diverse group of engineers, designers, and people with other backgrounds who invent useful, playful, and beautiful things. Or vision is to make life easier, more connected, more entertaining, more personal, and more productive. This is your opportunity to join our talented professionals as an intern to work on cutting-edge technologies and cool projects.

 

 

This internship will be 100% onsite or a combination of part-time remote/virtual and part-time in office.  

Responsibilities:

â€¢ Research the most efficient, effective, and practical methods for real-time audio augmentation using blind-source separation, denoising, speech enhancement, and the like
â€¢ Develop an understanding of technical risks and opportunities, articulating trade-offs between multiple methods towards this goal
â€¢ Implement a method to achieve the desired augmented hearing function
â€¢ Create a prototype of the system that showcases the experience
â€¢ Add a user interface which allows for intuitive interaction (based on COTS sensors and dev kits)
â€¢ Keep a focus on the holistic system throughout the internship

Qualifications:
