position: Rapid Prototyping for Robotic Audio Systems Intern
description:
Overview:

SUMMER 2022

 

Shure offers a challenging and rewarding summer internship program. The twelve week program is offered to undergraduate students that have completed at least 2 years of college, as well as graduate students. Each intern will receive a competitive salary and students who reside out of Illinois will receive a housing stipend to cover living expenses for hyrbid or onsite internships. Applications will be collected, reviewed and selected candidates will be contacted in late fall/early winter.

 

The Strategic Technology Team is looking for a full-stack hardware and software developer to help research, prototype, and demonstrate forward-leaning use cases with next generation technologies for future product opportunities.

 

As intern for Rapid Prototyping for Robotic Audio Systems, you will work on projects that relate to smart audio systems that incorporate robotic and micro robotic technologies, used for locomotion, shape-shifting and shape morphing, or other purposes that enable novel features and use cases. The project may target devices categories such as headphones, microphones, conference call systems, and other product categories.

 

We are a diverse group of engineers, designers, and people with other backgrounds who invent useful, playful, and beautiful things. Or vision is to make life easier, more connected, more entertaining, more personal, and more productive. This is your opportunity to join our talented professionals as an intern to work on cutting-edge technologies and cool projects.

 

This internship will be 100% onsite or a combination of part-time remote/virtual and part-time in office.

Responsibilities:

â€¢ Consume cutting edge research related to the broad domains of audio and robotics
â€¢ Work with the team to determine the area of focus, and specifically the implementation you will pursue for your prototype and design the area of focus, and specifically the implementation you will pursue for your prototype
â€¢ Research, source, evaluate, and select hardware and software methods and technologies that enable your specific implementation
â€¢ Implement and integrate the system
â€¢ Test, validate, and iterate on the prototype system
â€¢ Keep a focus on the holistic system throughout the internship

Qualifications:

â€¢ On track for MS in Computer Science, Robotics, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Mechanical Engineering, or related field
ï‚§ Will consider an intern having completed 3 yrs toward bachelor plus previous internship experience
â€¢ Coding skills in at least one low level language (e.g., C/C++) and one high-level language (e.g., Python) is required
â€¢ Experience with common rapid prototyping tools and dev kits for robotics and actuators is required
â€¢ Creativity and curiosity for future technologies and a passion for realizing new capabilities is required
â€¢ An interest in or experience with audio technologies and methods is a plus
â€¢ Experience using ML techniques to enable robotic systems with sensors and actuator is a plus

Job Description
Want to work with the best and brightest in a company that takes on challenges Never Been Done Before? Emersonrsquo;s Process Systems and Solutions business develops automation software that streamlines manufacturing processes. We are looking for students who are interested in gaining real-world experience in this dynamic environment.

Why Stellantis: Build your brand. Tell your story. Take advantage of a rare opportunity to do something great. We are looking for technology game changers to help Stellantis lead a transformation within the automotive industry. Technology has the potential to disrupt the automotive industry significantly in the next decade, and our IT organization is seeking high potential candidates to digitally transform the company with a focus on customer experience. Interns that demonstrate exceptional skills have an opportunity to be selected for full time work or a three-year Leadership Development Program at the end of the summer. In the IT department at Stellantis, you will receive an opportunity to acquire valuable skills that will boost your future career potential while making an impact at a global company. 


A successful candidate will gain hands-on experience working among technology leaders and fellow interns, and will be trusted to deliver technical solutions aligned with our digital strategy. We believe that our employees should be equally capable of technical mastery and leadership skills. Candidates will have an opportunity to let their technical skills shine by being able to present deliverables to senior leadership within the IT department, and will be rewarded with opportunities for full time employment after graduation. 


If you share a love for cars and technology and want to be a part of something great, the IT department at Stellantis is the place for you! 


As a summer intern, you will work in one of the following IT areas based on interest, skills, and background: Business Analytics, Data Science, Data Engineering Cloud Infrastructure Cyber Security Product & Powertrain Development Manufacturing Technologies Digital Sales; Marketing Connected Vehicle and Infotainment Services Mobile Application Development Network Engineering End User Services; Quality; Vehicle Safety Systems Supply Chain; Logistics Digital Innovation; Autonomous Technology.

* Majoring in Computer Science, Data Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Cyber Security, Information Technology, or related field

* Strong interest in automotive industry 
* Strong written and oral communication skills 
* Problem solving experience 
* Good interpersonal skills 
* Interest in working within an office or manufacturing environment 
* Display of strong leadership characteristics

position: Cyber Security Intern - Summer 2022- FUTURE OPPORTUNITIES
description:
This job posting is an “Evergreen Requisition” designed to gather talent for current or future open positions. It Is a way for Conagra to expedite the hiring process when there is a need to fill that type of role. By applying to an Evergreen Requisition, you are expressing your interest in a particular job function within Conagra. Your application will be reviewed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist who may reach out to learn more about your career interests, and how that may best fit with Conagra. In addition to submitting your resume to an Evergreen Requisition, we encourage you to create a job search agent to be alerted when positions in your areas of interest become available.

Who is Conagra Brands?

We are an approximately $8 billion company that combines a rich heritage of making great food with a sharpened focus and entrepreneurial spirit. We’re transforming the way we operate to fulfill what consumers and customers want, in a smart, simple way. We’re modernizing our iconic food brands, leveraging fresh opportunities and adapting to a changing landscape – all with a culture that’s ready to capture growth and drive shareholder value.

What Can You Expect from Your Internship?

Your internship will be an 11-week immersion into Conagra Brands and our GBIS (Global Business Information Services) organization.

Your internship will be an immersion into Conagra Brands and our GBIS (Global Business Information Services) organization. Within GBIS, you will work in our Information Security & Risk Management (ISRM) organization. As an intern within ISRM, you will gain hands-on experience in cybersecurity operations as well as broad exposure to all security domains. You will support and improve our SIEM, email protection, network monitoring, end-point protection, and security awareness program to name a few. To enhance your overall understanding of our company, we will provide opportunities to network with peers and leaders to gain an appreciation for the breadth of career paths available at Conagra Brands. 

Location: Omaha, NE

Schedule: Interns will work 40 hours a week May 23 – August 5, 2022 with potential for part-time hours extending through the school year

What are the Perks of Being an Intern at Conagra?

  • Paid Internship
  • Housing Assistance will be available to those who do not have housing in Omaha
  • Social and Professional Development Opportunities, such as Intern Orientation, Lessons from Leaders and a Summer Send Off
  • Functional and Cross Functional Trainings, Overviews, and Learnings
  • Assigned dedicated mentor
  • Intern class of 40+ students from 12+ colleges and universities across the country
  • Perks such as "dress for your day" attire, 1 p.m. dismissals on Fridays, and free downtown parking

Are You the Right Candidate?

We’re looking for a driven, highly motivated individual who wants to be part of cultivating the most energized, highest impact culture in the food industry. If you are craving an opportunity to build your talents, make a difference, and be empowered to kick start your professional career in a refuse-to-lose environment, then we want to meet you!  We encourage you to discover your own potential and we will provide you with unparalleled opportunities to make an impact.

Qualified candidates:

  • Are currently enrolled in a degree program with at least 1 semester remaining after your internship
  • Will graduate May 2023 or later
  • Are pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Cyber Security, or similar majors best suited for this position
  • Minimum 3.0 GPA required
  • Strong interest in technology and enjoys solving problems with analytical solutions
  • Dashboard and report development experience
  • High learning agility
  • Must attach a resume to your application and should indicate anticipated graduation date and current GPA
  • Must not require visa sponsorship now or in the future and must be authorized to work in the United States

Come join us if you’re looking for an internship allowing you to blend your technical skills with your business acumen! We’re looking for Solutions Engineering Interns that can be a connector between people, technology, and business.

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

What is a Solutions Engineer?

As a Solutions Engineer, you’ll combine your technical aptitude, exceptional communication skills, and creative problem solving to drive product adoption and success. Solutions Engineers work alongside with engineers, product managers and the sales team to engage with our customers in order to solve their most challenging problems using Splunk. Solutions Engineers work with clients to understand real-world business problems and solve them by building & architecting technology.

What you’ll do as a Splunktern?

Splunk Solutions Engineer Interns will get the opportunity to learn Splunk technology, features, solutions and applications. As a Solutions Engineer Intern, you will get the opportunity to:

  • Develop a project that will contribute to real-life improvements with high impact
  • Evangelize our product and services to customers
  • Collaborate with various Splunk teams
  • Receive multiple Splunk coveted certifications
  • Collaborate with others across Solutions Engineering interns, Solutions Engineering teams and other teams
  • Travel to various markets to assist with Splunk’s product adoption and positioning

Who are we looking for?

  • Actively pursuing a BS degree program in computer science, engineering or a related discipline
  • Must be currently enrolled in a degree program or equivalent with a graduation/completion date of December 2022 or beyond.
  • You possess strong written and communication skills. You have interest in cloud technologies, cybersecurity, and machine learning
  • You have the ability to explain technical concepts to a wide range of audiences, you’re passionate about learning, and thrive under pressure.
  • Domain expertise with IT Operations, Application Management and/or Security is desirable.

Are you looking for an incredible place to work that celebrates innovation, leadership and creativity? Please contact us. Splunk offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits. When you join Splunk you'll be working with a team of smart people who are as passionate about our products as our customers' success.

We value diversity at our company. As part of our collective mission of Feeding the Future, Nutrien Ag Solutions provides full-acre solutions through our trusted crop consultants at more than 2,000 locations in North America, South America, Europe and Australia. For more than 150 years, we have been helping growers achieve the highest yields with a wide selection of products, including our proprietary brands: Loveland Products, Inc.; Proven®Seed and Dyna-Gro®Seed; as well as financial, custom application and precision ag services.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, who are innovators in search of a better way, and who believe in inclusion.

Working at Nutrien Ag Solutions will provide you an opportunity to help us Feed the Future, and grow your career.

Located at our office in Loveland, CO, this position is an exciting opportunity and will provide invaluable work experience in a growing company. This is a summer internship which will last approximately 12 weeks.Reporting to the Supply Chain Excellence team, this position will provide technical and project coordination support initiatives across the Supply Chain function including Demand & Supply Planning, Transportation, Distribution & Logistics (TD&L) and Fleet

What you will do:

  • Gaining exposure to Supply Chain functions
  • Developing and analyzing datasets for business insights
  • Planning, organizing, and implementing effective strategies using company programs, tools, and initiatives
  • Developing Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for different functions
  • Serving on a larger project team focused on uncovering fresh sources of efficiency, operational capability, and other sources of supply chain improvement

What you will bring:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelors’ Degree in Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent degree program with a graduation date of Aug 2022 or later
  • Must have strong and proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel, PowerPoint and Visio

Compensation & Benefits:

 

Salary Range:  $17.31-$25.18/hour 

 

We provide a benefits package that includes catastrophic coverages including life, accidental death and dismemberment, and business travel accident insurance for a position of at least three months in duration and more than 30 hours per week.  Our benefit package also demonstrates our culture of care with paid sick days and holidays as well as an Employee and Family Assistance Program.  A Student or Intern role does not participate in any retirement savings or incentive programs.  Nutrien will comply with benefit and retirement regulations, as necessary.  Details of the benefits package will be shared in the application process.

 

This information is provided in compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act and is the company's good faith and reasonable estimate of the compensation range and benefits offered for this position.  The compensation offered to the successful applicant may vary based on factors including experience, skills, education, location, and other job-related reasons.  Nutrien also makes internal equity a consideration in all pay decisions.

We are currently seeking a Server Repair Intern to support Linode’s cloud infrastructure. You will focus on timely troubleshooting, repair, and redeployment of servers, networking equipment, and related infrastructure that isn’t functioning as intended. You will support Linode’s complete global infrastructure fleet, both physically and virtually. Most importantly, you will be a key component to the Linode Hardware Engineering Team in supporting our hardware, documentation, maintaining inventories, and shipping/receiving.

You will be a natural problem solver and someone who is able to quickly make repairs without costing unnecessary downtime. Impeccable communication skills along with the technical skills to do the job are a must. You will be passionate about IT, quick to grasp new concepts, and have a strong desire to help others. In addition, you will thrive in a high-energy environment where you must solve problems and perform work that is routinely done with minimal direct supervision.

This position will report to Linode’s Hardware Operations Manager. This Internship requires a physical presence in one of our Philadelphia locations.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Perform onsite server repairs.
  • Troubleshoot, plan, and execute repairs
  • Work with data center personnel to coordinate shipping and receiving
  • Maintain vendor contacts for RMAs, warranty claims, replacement parts, etc.
  • Manage the process of placing repaired equipment back online
  • Manage inventory levels for production and retired servers as well as repair parts and components
  • Document best practices, repairs, and other workflows as assigned; maintain all existing relevant documentation

Job Requirements

  • Strong understanding of computer hardware and components
  • Ability to speak with Managers, technical/non-technical people, and datacenter contacts.
  • Strong ability to research, plan, and execute necessary repairs
  • Ability to work in our Philadelphia, PA location

Preferred Qualifications

  • Coursework in computer science or related technology discipline; certifications, associates degree, or other degree are a bonus
  • Experience working in a NOC environment or other computer/server repair environment with hands-on hardware experience
  • A+ or similar certification preferred

Work With Us

  • Headquartered in one of the coolest buildings in Philadelphia, Linode has plenty of inviting office space to work from, plus remote work options for most positions.
  • Work/Life Balance: We have flexible work hours, remote work options, and a very generous paid time off package including volunteer time off and even a paid day off on your birthday!
  • Your health matters: We cover up to 90% of medical premiums plus pay for 100% of out of pocket costs that insurance doesn’t take care of.
  • Retirement benefits: Linode provides a range of retirement benefits including contributions to your 401k plan, a generous profit sharing plan, and a pension plan.
  • Your family is important to us! Employees may benefit from fully paid parental leave, company sponsored 529(c) savings plans, and family-friendly company events.
  • Our benefits to support your wellbeing include fully paid access to online mental wellness programs through AbleTo for you and your family, $100 monthly wellness reimbursements, as well as a robust EAP (employee assistance plan) offering
  • Free hosting service: Take advantage of some Linode service - we’ll pick up the tab.
  • Competitive salary: It all begins with fair compensation. We believe in paying people well and rewarding those who go the extra mile. The compensation range for this position is between $20/hour to $25/hour based on a full-time schedule. The salary could vary outside of this range based on your specific skills and experience. Employees may also qualify for a bonus on top of base salary depending on company and individual performance.
  • Take a look at our careers site for a full listing of benefits: https://www.linode.com/company/careers/benefits/

Equal Employment, Equal Treatment, No Judgment

Linode is committed to a culture that creates a sense of inclusion and belonging. We understand that teams perform their best when they include people with diverse backgrounds and differing perspectives, but also that to achieve greatness, people need to feel like they can be themselves; they need to be equal, included, and comfortable in order to perform at their best. Linode stands for equal pay, equal treatment, and equal experiences for all of our people, past, present, and future, regardless of age, race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexuality, socioeconomic class, disability status, or any other differentiating factor. We strive to make sure every last person we interact with feels like they belong and has the same opportunities as everyone else.

About Linode

Since 2003, Linode has been providing cloud computing services to customers around the world. Linode offers compute, storage, and networking services from ten data centers in regions spanning North America, Europe, Asia, and Oceania. We are committed to making Linode the most simple, powerful, and reliable hosting provider that thousands of customers—from the fastest-growing startups to established enterprises—trust. This industry moves fast, but we strive to hire the kind of people who can stay a step ahead and keep us - and themselves - at the top. Overview

Spend your summer building something that matters!

 

Chick-fil-A Software Engineering Summer Interns sit at the intersection of modern tech and one of America’s fastest growing and most-loved brands. As a technical intern, you will apply software engineering skills to the restaurant business, contributing to a variety of technology projects that enables everything from the customer experience, to restaurant and kitchen operations, to the efficiency and effectiveness of our Support Center and supply chain network that empowers more than 2,600 restaurants. Our Software Engineering Summer Interns operate across a variety of technical disciplines, but all serve in a real-life working environment to gain firsthand experience building in cloud-based software products using modern code technologies and practices in an agile, team-based environment.

 

Technical interns have the opportunity to:

  • Build your proficiency in programming languages such as Java, JavaScript, Python, and Go
  • Work in technologies like AWS, Kubernetes, Github and Docker
  • Cultivate relationships across technical intern peers, Digital Transformation & Technology leadership, and Chick-fil-A leaders in other parts of the business
  • Develop your professional skills through one-on-one mentoring from a coach assigned to you over the summer
  • Experience a positive, people-first company culture that aims to serve customers, communities and one another well

 

Whatever your technical goals, we help match you to the right opportunity to help you grow personally and professionally.  To see some of the exciting work our team is engaged in, visit our Medium Blog.   

Responsibilities

Project examples from previous Chick-fil-A Software Engineering Summer Internships:

  • Enabling our customers to skip the line by building product enhancements in our Chick-fil-A One app 
  • Automating our restaurants by leveraging IoT devices for our kitchens 
  • Developing systems to make our restaurants the safest place to eat 
  • Supporting digital workplace transformation for corporate Staff
  • Equipping our restaurant Operators with a mobile app for business operation at their restaurant  

 

Job responsibilities & activities:

  • Contributing to current technical projects or initiatives with guidance from an intern coach
  • Learning about a variety of Chick-fil-A systems and technologies
  • Recommending new and innovative ways to solve current business and technical challenges
  • Attending professional development programming to learn from Chick-fil-A leaders to better understand and connect how technical roles enable business outcomes.

 

**AS PART OF THE APPLICATION PROCESS, CANDIDATES WILL BE ASKED TO TAKE AN ON-LINE TECHNICAL ASSESSMENT. 

 

Minimum Qualifications

  • Currently a junior pursuing a bachelor's degree in a technical field of study (MIS, Computer Science, Human Computer Interaction, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or other related technical majors)
  • Strong working knowledge of at least one major programming language (Java, JavaScript, Python, Go, or other comparable language)
  • Analytical mindset with an aptitude and eagerness to problem-solve
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Desire to spend the majority of time coding

Preferred Qualifications

  • Demonstration of creativity in problem solving
  • A track record of service and leadership through class projects, jobs and/or internships, or extracurriculars
  • A passion not only for technology and emerging technical trends, but also a passion for seeing it applied practically to real-life problems
  • Demonstrated eagerness to continually learn and improve your own technical knowledge

Required Level of Education

Bachelor's Degree

Major/Concentration

MIS, Computer Science, Human Computer Interaction, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or other related technical majors.

Minimum GPA (4.0 Scale)

3.0

To protect our nation, deployed forces, and allies in air, missile, and maritime engagements, our group defines future defense architectures, develops new algorithms, and identifies applications for new technologies to enhance the United States’ defenses against potential threats. Our staff members analyze all aspects of defense systems, including radar, infrared and laser sensors, satellites, and interceptors. We also look at the software and algorithms that enable these systems to search, track, identify, and intercept missiles, and inform decisions about battle management. We assess how adversaries might attempt to counter these systems, both physically and electronically.  Finally, we propose and evaluate new technologies and architectures to help maintain robust US capabilities in the future.

 

The successful candidate will contribute analysis to mature existing elements and to assess future concepts. Activities may include scientific programming, system modeling and analysis, the creation of simulation tools, and analysis of algorithm performance.

 

Successful candidate should be pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or similar technical field. Experience with MATLAB, Python, C, or C++ is desired.

 

Selected candidate will be subject to a pre-employment background investigation and must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret level DoD security clearance.

Description

NOTE: Candidates applying should be available from January 2nd to June 30th 2022.


Sense builds home monitoring technology to help people understand their household energy consumption, know what is going on in their homes, and ultimately reduce their energy footprint. We help make homes safer, more efficient, and more reliable. We are serious about impacting climate change, and we regularly measure reduction in carbon emissions from our technology.

Sense was founded in 2013 by pioneers in speech recognition technologies. This background provides the team with the intuition to unlock key insights relating to home energy efficiency and deliver those insights to customers. We use machine learning technology to provide real-time insights on device behavior. Customers rely on Sense for a wide range of uses including monitoring their home appliances, determining whether they left appliances running, finding faulty appliances, and identifying how to reduce energy costs.

We are looking for an intern or co-op to join our Data Science team in 2022. You’ll be diving into messy time-series data, improving our visualization tools, exploring data-driven modeling, and ultimately improving our customers’ visibility into their homes.

Requirements

We are looking for someone who is:

  • Passionate about the energy sector and climate change
  • Eager to work in a young, fast-paced, and exciting startup environment
  • A 3rd year, 4th year, or graduate student working towards a numeric degree: computer science, electrical engineering, applied mathematics, physics, etc.
  • Familiar with classifiers and regressors in machine learning.
  • Experienced in software development in Python.
  • Adept at communication: eager to learn insights from data and present them to the team.

Nice to have

  • Experienced in signal processing, time-series / frequency analysis, algorithms, and data structures.
  • Experience with Jupyter notebooks.
  • Experience with software development tools: git, testing, debugging.
  • Experience with deep learning frameworks such as Tensorflow or Pytorch.


Benefits

Benefits

  • Be a part of a team that will make a difference in the world.
  • Gain experience at a startup building a consumer product from the ground up.
  • Work with a small team of experienced entrepreneurs creating revolutionary technology.
  • Deep dive into a wide range of interesting software problems to be solved.

About Ping Identity:

At Ping Identity, we're changing the way people think about enterprise security technology. With our new Identity Defined Security platform, we're building a borderless world where people have total freedom to work wherever and however they want. Without friction. Without fear.

We call this digital freedom. And it's not just something we provide our customers. It's something that inspires our company. People don't come here to join a culture that's built on digital freedom. They come to cultivate it.

We're headquartered in Denver, Colorado, and we have offices and employees around the globe. And we serve the largest, most demanding enterprises worldwide, including over half of the Fortune 100. Because even in the most complex enterprise environments, security shouldn't be a source of anxiety. It is one of your greatest competitive advantages.

position: Intern - Web Application Developer (Blended: Onsite & Remote)
description:
Join Our Community of Food People!


The US Foods Summer Internship Program provides a forum for students to apply classroom skills and academic training in a real-world business environment. In addition to being assigned business-impacting projects throughout the summer, students will be matched with a manager who will meet with them on a regular basis to provide direction on assignments as well as deliver performance feedback and a mentor who will be available to offer day-to-day guidance and support.


Interns will also get exposure to US Foods executive leadership; have an opportunity to participate in learning and social events with other interns across business functions and have an opportunity to deliver an end of summer presentation to showcase their accomplishments with key business leaders.


US Foods internships are full-time paid positions (40 hours per week from June - August) with the possibility of transitioning to a full-time position post-graduation dependent on availability and overall performance.


This position has been segmented as Blended meaning the work is a combination of onsite and remote/virtual (as defined by the role segmentation).


Please note: We are unable to provide internships to students that require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B visa status). Candidates who possess the unqualified right to work in the United States are eligible to apply.


Local candidates are encouraged to apply. For qualified students whose permanent home of record is located outside 50 miles from US Foods Corporate HQ, a stipend will be offered to partially offset housing costs for the summer.


BASIC PURPOSE:


With direct supervision and oversight, the intern position provides exposure and opportunity to investigate a career, gain business knowledge and practical application of application development within the food distribution industry.


US Foods has a number of opportunities that will exercise and develop the intern’s skills in front-end and/or back-end web application development. Opportunities include our customer and employee web sites, portal-based internal applications, and mobile applications. The intern will engage in creating APIs that share product information, gather and submit order detail or execute data transformation services in addition to front end development all with the goal of creating an outstanding experience for users while leveraging the latest technologies.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


+ Assist and participate in project ideation - from concept to delivery

+ Gather information from existing systems, analyze program and time requirements

+ Prepare detailed specifications from which programs are developed and coded

+ Develop moderately complex programs

+ Ensure programs meet standards and technical specifications

+ Develop test plans to verify logic of new or modified programs

+ Create documentation of work assignments such as program code and technical documentation

+ Assist support and/or project personnel in resolving program issues


BASIC REQUIREMENTS:


+ Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems/Science or related area of study.

+ Must be enrolled in school during time of internship.

+ Typically, students currently between their Junior and Senior years or between their 1st and 2nd years of graduate school will be considered for internships.

+ Coursework or skill in object-oriented programming.

+ Coursework or skill in Java development.

+ Database server development experience.

+ Web application development experience OR hands-on website development experience.

+ Experience integrating front-end templates with back-end functionality.

+ Experience with front-end web development languages.


PREFERRED SKILLS:


Coursework or experience with:


+ Requirements gathering, design, implementation, integration and testing; developing database driven sites

+ Microservice Architecture

+ JDBC, JMS, Web Services, J2EE, Applet, Servlet, JSP, JSON.

+ HTML5, CSS3, Angular, JavaScript/jQuery

+ WebLogic, Tomcat

+ Docker, Kubernetes

+ Kafka

+ Swagger

+ AWS (API Gateway, WebSocket, Lambda, EC2, S3)

+ New Relic

+ Git


ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:


+ Must have regular, reliable method of transportation to commute to US Foods’ location

Job Summary: Cole Engineering Services is seeking a highly motivated candidate to support activities for an emerging simulation and training capability for the United States Army. The candidate will support test and evaluation activities to include development of test procedures, supporting the execution of test and evaluation events, and performing hardware and software analysis and troubleshooting across complex military systems.


Essential Job Functions:

  • Candidates will support the design, creation and execution of hardware/software test cases, scenarios, and procedures that incorporates the use of a variety of software applications and tools.
  • Assists in defining integration and testing processes and procedures.
  • Performs unit testing, configuration item and system level tests, and supports verification/validation testing as required.
  • Develops test plans and test reports for all levels of testing performed.
  • Works closely with the leads, development staff and systems engineers to thoroughly understand the system requirements and hardware/software implementation.
  • Works closely with leadership to identify and define testing strategies and plan resources to ensure adequate assets are in place for all testing activities.
  • Analyzes test results, metrics and trends and provides feedback to development and systems engineers.


Required Education/Experience:

  • Currently seeking Bachelor’s or Graduate coursework in a related technical discipline such as mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, industrial engineering, computer science, information technology, systems or software engineering from an accredited college or university.
  • Position is year-round. Hours are flexible based on coursework and academic commitments.


Knowledge in any of the following areas would be considered a plus:

  • Hardware troubleshooting and fault diagnosis.
  • Knowledge and experience of testing methodologies and analyzing results from small-scale unit testing to large-scale system testing.
  • Knowledge/experience with Industry best-practice software development and collaboration tools such as JIRA and Confluence.
  • Experience operating in a collaborative work environment.


Other Requirements: Please note that pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires U. S. Citizenship status with ability to obtain a SECRET security clearance.

About Genesis

Genesis is a global leader in institutional digital asset markets. We provide a single point of access for digital asset trading, derivatives, borrowing, lending, custody and prime brokerage services.

Genesis facilitates billions in trades, loans and transactions on a monthly basis, including over $25 billion in 2020 YTD. We have a proven track record driving results for some of the largest digital asset-focused hedge funds, quant funds, family offices, VC’s, market makers and exchanges.


Join Our Team

Genesis is expanding to solve some of the toughest challenges in digital asset financial markets.


About This Role – Software Engineer Intern

Interns work on meaningful projects and their work can have a lasting impact at Genesis. In addition to doing hands-on work, you will also learn about how all the teams at Genesis work together to solve some of the toughest challenges in the digital assets market.

This is a unique opportunity to have a front row seat to the growth of an asset class. As a trading intern you may have the opportunity to work on:

  • Participating in design sessions with the development team.
  • Assisting the development and maintenance of core Go and Python trading platform components.

  • Reviewing and recommending architectural improvements.
  • Troubleshooting production-impacting issues and helping provide timely solutions.


Requirements

  • A strong interest in the digital asset trading industry.
  • Ability to demonstrate autonomy and ownership, while evolving in a team environment.
  • Thrives in a dynamic and high-pressured environment.
  • Good verbal, presentation, and written communication skills as you work across departments.
  • Currently enrolled in a university, graduating between Dec 2022 – May 2023.
  • Legally authorized to work in the US without visa sponsorship.
  • Available to work for the duration of 8-10 weeks starting in mid-May 2022.


Why Genesis

Genesis facilitates billions in trades, loans and transactions on a monthly basis, including over $45 billion in 2020. We have a proven track record driving results for some of the largest digital asset-focused hedge funds, quant funds, family offices, VC’s, market makers and exchanges.


Digital Asset Ecosystem

Genesis operates at the heart of the digital asset ecosystem:

→ We are a subsidiary of Digital Currency Group (DCG), the largest investor in the bitcoin and blockchain space.

→ We have an unparalleled global network at the intersection of data, finance and technology.


Accelerating Momentum

Our addressable market is expanding rapidly as new institutional investors enter the space. Recent results include:

→ 400%+ Y/Y trading volume growth to $20.7 billion in trades

→ 400%+ Y/Y loan origination growth to $19 billion in originations

→ 300%+ Y/Y active loan growth to $3.9 billion in active loans outstanding

→ 400%+ Q/Q derivatives transaction growth to $5.9 billion in transactions


Diversity And Inclusion

Genesis invests in creating a welcoming environment where everyone can feel supported and connected at work.

→ We help employees develop a deep understanding of the problems we’re trying to solve.

→ We thrive on ideas driven by a broad range of perspectives.

→ We believe diverse teams lead to better products and bigger outcomes.

description:

Since our beginning in a Silicon Valley garage, the entrepreneurial spirit and passion at Keysight Technologies has been focused on one mission: helping customers accelerate innovation to connect and secure the world. Join us and become part of our journey as we innovate solutions that enable the Information Era and its world-changing outcomes. We are looking for team-oriented, technically curious self-starters to join our IT College Program for an exciting internship where you will develop the skills of the next generation of Software Engineering or Enterprise Networking talent to pioneer the future of a technology-enabled world and beyond.

Launch into your 2021 Fall internship as part of our global IT organization responsible for enterprise networks, computing, digital productivity solutions, and end-user technology endpoints. We are in the midst of transforming and automating the end-user digital experience for our 20,000 internal stakeholders through innovative software solutions. From day 1, you will collaborate with your peers to work on knock-out products with high business value. You will be introduced to our business and technical environments, with support along the way as you work with different technologies across the organization to develop a software solution that drives business outcomes. Within this environment, you will have exposure to numerous technologies within our IT delivery framework, leveraging your technical savvy to blow away our end-users with beautiful front ends, powerful back ends, and brilliant hardware architectures. Who We Are:

We bring highly specialized Human Capital Management (HCM) technology and services to enterprise-level clients.  Specializing in the HR, payroll, and workforce management industry segments, we enable clients in all 50 states and across the world to optimize their people, systems, and processes unlike any other vendor in the space.  Our fast-growing organization is looking to build our team of experts, giving them the freedom to take leadership and develop professionally while working with a diverse array of clients, technologies, and services.  We provide industry-best consultants and breakthrough technologies into the HCM space, and have a motivated team to further accelerate our expansion in the marketplace.

  • Work with the internal team to facilitate the design, configuration, testing, or deployment of Human Resource Information Systems (HRIS) solutions for our client partners.

    • Map and optimize business processes and complex transactions.

  • Build a 'full stack' demo which combines the data model, analytics, IPaaS, and process automation.
    • Bring together our key technology offerings in a working demo.
    • Provide recommendations on leveraging a preferred data warehouse for clients.
  •   Will get training and/or certification in one of more of the following:
    • Qlik Sense.
    • HelpSystems Automate.
    • Dell Boomi.

Required:

  • Active student pursuing a bachelor's degree.
  • Dependable, great attitude and team player.
  • Excellent and creative problem-solving and analytical skills.

Preferred:

  • Active student pursuing a bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Computer Engineering.

Xylem, a leading global water technology company dedicated to solving the world’s most challenging water issues, is the leading global provider of efficient, innovative and sustainable water technologies improving the way water is used, managed, conserved and re-used. Our international team is unified in a common purpose: creating advanced technology and other trusted solutions to solve the world’s water challenges. We are committed to creating an organization of inclusion and diversity, where everyone feels involved, respected, valued and connected, and where everyone is free to bring their authentic selves and ideas.

If you are excited and passionate about helping us #letssolvewater, we want to hear from you! For more information, please visit us at www.xylem.com​.

We Offer You More Than Just “A Job”

  • Professional Development – To advance the capabilities of our people, we offer a wide variety of experiences to support our employees’ professional growth and continuous learning.
  • Total Rewards – We offer comprehensive programs for compensation, benefits, recognition, learning and development, work-life integration and corporate citizenship.
  • Watermark – Watermark is our corporate social responsibility program working to provide education and access to safe water to ensure healthy lives, gender equality, and resilient communities. Employees have the opportunity to learn and volunteer on various water-related projects.
  • Employee Networks – Our Employee Networks provide a professional, supportive network for employees from diverse backgrounds, including Women’s, LGBT+ and Allies, Veteran’s, People of Color and Allies, Emerging Leaders, Hispanic Origin & Latin Affinity, Emerging Leaders, and Working Parents Networks.

The Role: Xylem seeks to hire a Data Science Intern. You will be analyzing millions of time series using state of the art statistical methods, advanced machine learning, and big data technologies.  Our data science team is a friendly collaborative environment. If you are excited and passionate to work on state-of-the art technology trends we want to hear from you! 

Essential Duties/Principal Responsibilities:

  • Passion for applications, analytics, storage and distributed systems
  • Enjoy working in a fast-paced agile environment using Scrum
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong customer focus

  • Experience with object oriented coding languages such as Java and Python
  • Experience with R programming language
  • Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment of engineers to meet aggressive goals and high quality standards
  • Demonstrated experience working with cross functional teams

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with online distributed systems and platform infrastructure design and implementation
  • Experience with the Hadoop ecosystem and Spark
  • Experience in databases, analytics, big data systems or business intelligence products

[ As of June 2020, Quora has become a "remote-first" company. This position can be performed remotely from anywhere in the world, regardless of any location that might be specified above.]

About Quora:

The vast majority of human knowledge is still not on the internet. Most of it is trapped in the form of experience in people's heads, or buried in books and papers that only experts can access. More than a billion people use the internet, yet only a tiny fraction contribute their knowledge to it. We want to democratize access to knowledge of all kinds — from politics to painting, cooking to coding, etymology to experiences — so if someone out there knows something, anyone else can learn it. Our mission is to share and grow the world's knowledge, and we're building a world-class team to help us achieve this mission.

About our Internship:

A Quora internship is not an ordinary internship. There's no busy work. Every project that our interns work on is important to the company and its goals.

As a team, we are dedicated to holding high standards, developing a strong and passionate culture, and emphasizing impact. We value building a culture with strong engineering values and goals because we believe that it is the key to building a great company and product. Interns play an important role in this, as they work alongside full-time employees as equals, working on the same projects that help drive the company and product forward. We expect interns to become valuable contributors to the team, as they work hand-in-hand with people ranging from engineering to design to business development.

We also realize that mentorship is important to allow interns to grow and develop skills in areas which they're looking to improve. For example, every intern will have a full-time engineer as a mentor, and weekly 1:1s with their managers to get feedback and ensure things are going well. We also emphasize code reviews and hold weekly engineering tech talks to maintain high code quality and to optimize for learning the best engineering practices.

Interns can expect to work in the same areas as full-time engineers, which include:

  • Product Systems: architect and scale user-facing product features to drive engagement and help the product grow.
  • Platform: create the tools, abstractions, frameworks, and systems to make developers at Quora more productive across all platforms — from product developers to ML engineers.
  • Infrastructure: design and build fast, cost-efficient, self-healing and scalable architectures to serve our ever-growing global traffic and storage needs.
  • Machine Learning: build systems and processes that apply ML technologies, including ranking, content quality, text understanding, search, ads targeting and CTR prediction, etc.


Minimum Qualifications:

  • Pursuing a B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field
  • Knowledge of Python, Javascript, or C++, or the ability to learn them quickly
  • A passion for learning and always improving yourself and the team around you
  • Love of the Quora product

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Prior software engineering internship experience with web applications, databases, or distributed systems

Description

We are looking for a Cyber-Security Threat Engineer Intern for our office in the greater Kansas City area. In this role you will be responsible for learning and conducting basic security audits from both a logical and theoretical standpoint and a technical and hands-on standpoint. Other essential functions include:

  • Fundamental understanding with industry trusted infrastructure and development penetration tools.
  • Fundamental understanding with security, infrastructure, software development, and application technologies.
  • Learn / gain proficiency with standard methods of reconnaissance, information gathering including network analysis, web application analysis, database analysis
  • Learn / gain proficiency with various methods of threat modeling and vulnerability assessment including vulnerability scanners, password crackers, network protocol attacks
  • Strong desire to gain experience of common penetration tools toward a deeper understanding of the technology that is needed to reveal vulnerabilities that standard tool proficiency does not.
  • Driven to learn or gain experience with device hacking / reverse engineering of products and devices


Qualifications

Qualified candidates are Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Cyber Security, Computer Science, Management Information Systems or a field relevant to perform the essential functions of this job description and hold cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. Other requirements include:

  • Basic understanding of Vulnerability Scanning and Penetration Testing tools (such as Nessus, Metasploit, Burp Suite, Nmap, Wireshark or other)

  • Demonstrated strong and effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

  • Must possess relevant experience and/or training

  • Must possess relevant education and/or experiences as required for the specific projects he/she will develop


Excellent academics including a cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.5 and previous experience working in a team environment is highly preferred!

position: Intern - Supply Chain - Warehouse Optimization (Blended: Onsite & Remote)
description:
Join Our Community of Food People!


The US Foods Summer Internship Program provides a forum for students to apply classroom skills and academic training in a real-world business environment. In addition to being assigned business-impacting projects throughout the summer, students will be matched with a manager who will meet with them on a regular basis to provide direction on assignments as well as deliver performance feedback and a mentor who will be available to offer day-to-day guidance and support.


Interns will also get exposure to US Foods executive leadership; have an opportunity to participate in learning and social events with other interns across business functions and have an opportunity to deliver an end of summer presentation to showcase their accomplishments with key business leaders.


US Foods internships are full-time paid positions (40 hours per week from June - August) with the possibility of transitioning to a full-time position post-graduation dependent on availability and overall performance.


This position has been segmented as Blended meaning the work is a combination of onsite and remote/virtual (as defined by the role segmentation).


Please note: We are unable to provide internships to students that require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B visa status). Candidates who possess the unqualified right to work in the United States are eligible to apply.


Local candidates are encouraged to apply. For qualified students whose permanent home of record is located outside 50 miles from US Foods Corporate HQ, a stipend will be offered to partially offset housing costs for the summer.


BASIC PURPOSE:


We are looking for a well-rounded individual possessing excellent personal and technical skills with a strong desire to gain experience in Supply Chain Optimization.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


+ Provide day-to-day support to the Warehouse Optimization and Industrial Engineering group

+ Perform intermediate to advanced data collection and analysis using MS Access/Excel

+ Create mathematical models using appropriate techniques (such as heuristics) and leveraging secondary and tertiary data

+ Develop forward-thinking tools to support operations (Microsoft PowerApps, Tableau dashboards, Macro-enabled reports, etc.)

+ Manage technical projects and initiatives to deliver targeted cost savings

+ Cross-functional collaboration with other departments (Operations, Safety, Quality, Transportation, IT, etc.)

+ Map out processes and conduct root-cause analyses by applying Lean Six Sigma methodologies

+ Formally present recommendations and findings to senior management


BASIC REQUIREMENTS:


+ Currently pursuing a 4-year degree at an accredited institution, preferably with completed coursework related to Supply Chain Management, Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science. Industrial Engineering student is highly preferred.

+ Typically, students currently between their Junior and Senior years or between their 1st and 2nd years of graduate school will be considered for internships

+ High proficiency in Microsoft Access, Excel and PowerPoint

+ Solid foundation in Mathematics and Statistics

+ Data mining; Visual Basic/SQL programming

+ Good verbal and writing skills

+ Ability to learn quickly and work independently with little supervision


PREFFERED SKILLS :


+ Software: AutoCAD, Visio, Tableau, Minitab

+ Programming: VBA, SQL, PowerApps/Power BI, Python, R

+ Continuous Improvement/Lean Six Sigma coursework

+ Exposure to Work Measurement (Engineered Labor Standards)

+ Previous internship in distribution setting (warehouse and/or transportation)


TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:


Less than 10%


ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:


+ Must have regular, reliable method of transportation to commute to US Foods’ location.

Our workplace safety efforts include using sanitized interview rooms, social distancing, providing masks and gloves and sanitizing truck cab interiors. We also have COVID-19 Wellness Checks for anyone entering our facilities and safety barriers in select locations in our production facilities. To help our customers make it in this challenging time, we’re providing robust support including webinars, one-on-one consults with our experts and detailed reopening materials.


US Foods is proud to have donated $10 million in food to help with COVID-19 relief efforts to help our local communities make it. Learn more here .


US Foods is one of America’s great food companies and a leading foodservice distributor, partnering with approximately 300,000 restaurants and foodservice operators to help their businesses succeed. With 28,000 employees and more than 70 locations, US Foods provides its customers with a broad and innovative food offering and a comprehensive suite of e-commerce, technology and business solutions. US Foods is headquartered in Rosemont, Ill., and generates more than $28 billion in annual revenue. Visit www.usfoods.com to learn more.

Date: Sep 7, 2021


Location:

Milwaukee, WI, US


Requisition ID: 17818


A Career in Beer:


Our purpose at the Molson Coors Beverage Company is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world. We’re Talent Brewers - we believe in our brands and our people; we believe that an inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate people who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get excited about making a difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.


The Headlines:


As an Emerging Tech Intern you will be part of our Early Talent Program. Our Early Talent Program is Molson Coors’ undergraduate summer internship program, where students are exposed to the beverage industry, engaged in real-world problem-solving, and immersed in social and educational opportunities with other interns. The internship is full-time, beginning in June through August. Housing assistance is available to candidates who meet eligibility requirements.Interns who successfully complete the Early Talent Program are eligible for full-time positions within Molson Coors Beverage Company, upon graduation.


The Responsibilities:


You will have an opportunity to solve critical business problems and contribute meaningful value to our organization. While you will gain exposure to various aspects of our IT department, the highlight of your internship will be an innovative project for which you will present at the conclusion of the program to MCBC cross-functional leadership. Your day-to-day activities and project will mirror the work processes of our Emerging Tech team. While you will have significant autonomy to drive your project deliverables, you will have the full support and guidance of your manager and larger organization.


+ Innovative project focused on Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Internet of Things, and/or other related emerging technologies

+ Leverage industry trends along with innovation tools and best practices to research, analyze, prototype, and pitch a new solution to a relevant challenge in collaboration with technology and business partners

+ Assist with local tech community programming and internal engagement activities

+ Inside look at technology operations and careers


The Other Qualifications:


+ You are currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related STEM field

+ Passionate about emerging technologies

+ Strong problem-solving and analytical capabilities

+ Self-starter and innovative mindset

+ Effective communication skills

+ Thrives in ambiguous situations

+ Resilient to overcome obstacles

+ Driven and demonstrates a bias for action

Introduction
Ready to re-imagine the product management role?  At IBM, as a Product Manager, you are responsible for the full lifecycle of a product: from validating need to determining the business model and defining the solution requirements. Going beyond the traditional focus of timetables and budgets, you use your keen insights into what customers want in their own business plan - and work across disciplines to build the best solutions to a problem. If being the CEO of your product excites you, consider a product management career at IBM.

Your Role and Responsibilities

Start and end dates for this internship are during summer 2022 (3 months)

IBM Product Management transforms how we take Products to market by first focusing on the needs of the client. We are looking for early-career, technically minded entrepreneurs for an intensive internship program with product teams who are solving complex problems in a fast-paced, changing world. Selected interns will be considered for the Associate Product Manager (APM) Program. The Associate Product Manager (APM) Program is the cornerstone of this transformation.

Our interns operate at the center of multidisciplinary teams which include design, engineering, sales, marketing, finance and legal. These product teams serve our clients’ needs under ever-shifting circumstances and have passion for solving user problems with technology.

Interns in this program at IBM build deep and broad skills including market and competitive analysis, planning, and shepherding product development, driving adoption through marketing and digital engagement, and sensing how products are performing in the market.

You will work with experienced IBM product managers, designers and engineers who will challenge you and provide opportunities to accelerate your growth. You will build valuable experience and organizational eminence through mentors and opportunities to network across the business.

When considering applicants for this role, we look for education and background in a combination of areas such as business / data analytics, computer science, design thinking, engineering, entrepreneurship, go-to-market (GTM) strategy, market / user research, product management, product development, and technology commercialization.

We look for candidates who exhibit the aptitude and experience relevant to product management. We look for candidates with passion, grit, and curiosity.

During this internship you'll be matched and deployed to a product team in one of our office-based IBM locations listed in this posting.

IBM Product Managers deliver business results by bringing high-quality products to market by defining the strategy and execution plans while continuously innovating to achieve market leadership. Product Managers are experts at market and business analysis, product definition, product roadmap, pricing, ecosystem, channel strategy, strategic planning, competitive analysis, innovation, and leading cross-functional teams. They manage the product lifecycle from inception through growth, maturity, and end of life stages and define partnership and ecosystem strategy for product execution. Product Managers maximize internal and external relationships interfacing with design, product marketing, ecosystem partners, analysts, engineering, sales, and services teams to deliver a successful product with defined routes to market. They are experts in the field and are recognized as a credible voice in the market.

Join the next generation of user-centric, data-driven, innovators and entrepreneurs who are working to solve big, meaningful problems.



Required Technical and Professional Expertise
  • Must have basic knowledge in product management, product development, entrepreneurship, or other related work.
  • English: Fluent


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
  • At least 1 year of experience in product management, product development, entrepreneurship, design thinking, market research, go-to-market (GTM) strategy, business analytics, or other related work.

About Business Unit
IBM Corporate Headquarters (CHQ) team represents a variety of functions such as marketing, finance, legal, operations, HR, and more, all working together to solve some of the world's most complex problems, help our clients achieve success and build collaborative work environments for IBMers.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Being You @ IBM

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. Following high customer demand we continue to improve performance and work with our customers to add features that will help them accelerate more machine learning workloads.

We are building complex products that are simple to understand, quick to get started on, and easy to scale. position: Brand Technical Sales Specialist Intern – IBM Summit Summer 2022
description:
Introduction
The IBM Global Markets team is seeking highly talented undergraduate level students to fill consultative, client-focused, technical sales intern roles.

At IBM, we’re motivated by more than just selling solutions. We want our clients to succeed. Our clients have the future in mind, and your job is to help them get there. As part of IBM’s sales team, you will work with clients as they transform organizations and entire industries. As an IBMer, you will have access to the entire organization to develop creative ideas that help clients build the world they envision.

This is a summer 2022 position. Applicants should be rising Junior or rising Senior students pursuing a bachelor’s degree in the areas of Computer Science, Data Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Electrical Engineering, Information Technology, or similar disciplines. Intern positions are in major cities across the US.

Your Role and Responsibilities
IBM solves the world’s problems. Be a part of the solution!

You will actively:

• Help clients grow their businesses by solving strategic and tactical business problems with IBM’s proven AI, Cloud, and hardware technology solutions
• Work with clients to drive revenue through in-depth, complex technical demonstrations, designing solutions, technical evaluations, and/or proof-of- concepts
• Prospect for new business to generate interest in IBM offerings
• Drive client value and client satisfaction by using your technical expertise to address client business challenges
• Grow skills and knowledge in consultative sales, technical solutions, and industry applications to demonstrate IBM’s thought leadership during client engagements
• Work in a rapidly changing environment where no two days are the same
• Interact with a variety of other talented, motivated colleagues

This position requires a real passion for client success, sales achievement, and daily collaboration with clients and other IBM teammates. You may work with any of the following: Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, Cloud, Internet of Things, Security or Systems Hardware.

Please note: This role will involve technical consulting with clients; helping them design technical solutions.

Brand Technical Sales Specialist Interns have a passion for sales and are successful in the following:

• Aptitude to learn and use innovative selling technologies (e.g., analytics, social media) to network, engage clients, identify new business opportunities, and translate business requirements into technology solutions
• Conversant and knowledgeable about technology, trends and how technology is being applied to address business challenges
• Capacity to grasp and communicate technical details
• Team collaboration and leadership
• Motivation to accomplish sales and business objectives
• Professional verbal, written, and interpersonal skills
• Empathy and skills to achieve high levels of customer satisfaction
• Be able to independently travel to local IBM clients and meetings

Summit2022

IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

description:

Before there were smartphones or smart cities, before autonomous cars or 360° virtual reality videos, there was our technology. Headquartered in San Diego, for over 30 years Qualcomm inventions have inspired others to make the impossible, possible. From 5G to artificial intelligence, from IoT to automotive and extended reality applications, Qualcomm is inventing the technologies of an intelligently connected future, spearheading research efforts for the next global wireless standard, and collaborating with industry leaders in the wireless value chain to make this future a commercial reality.

Responsibilities

JOB TITLE DevOps Engineering Intern

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work. You’ll have the opportunity to grow and learn in a culture that empowers your development. We have created an inclusive, global environment that values the power of diverse talent, backgrounds, and experiences to drive speed, productivity, innovation, and growth.

Our internship program will give you a chance to get real world business experience and build your network before graduation. We are seeking an energetic, responsible intern to join our growing organization. In this position, you will be expected to learn the ins-and-outs of our daily routines and procedures. You will focus on learning how our organization runs, and can be expected to gain valuable insight that can further your interest in your chosen career field.

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science. With revenues of $20 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our 70,000 employees the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world. The customers we serve fall within pharmaceutical and biotech companies, hospitals and clinical diagnostic labs, universities, research institutions and government agencies. Our products and services help accelerate the pace of scientific discovery, and solve challenges ranging from complex research to routine testing to field applications.

SUMMARY OF INTERNSHIP

The DevOps Engineering Internship position provides an opportunity for engineering students who are currently pursuing a computer science, computer engineering, or like engineering degree to get hands on experience working with engineers in a fast-paced software design and software quality assurance environment. The intern will contribute to DevOps projects and advance best design practices. THE POSITION STARTS IN JUNE, PAID WORKING 40 HOURS PER WEEK THROUGH AUGUST.

The DevOps Engineering Intern will help implement and manage the tools, processes and cloud environments to automate our build, test and deployment of our software platform in the cloud to ensure the delivery team’s success. The DevOps Engineering Intern is a part of the Engineering Department.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Design, promote and support repeatable and friction-less Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
Seek quality and cost savings by automating any process we execute more than once
Manage the source code repository, building and versioning for products and customer implementations
Design, promote, and support containers, microservices and cloud deployment on AWS
Work in a fast-paced environment with agile development and DevOps culture
Develop and manage code analysis and test automation frameworks
Conduct DevOps tool research, evaluation, proof of concept, installation, configuration and training
Troubleshoot and resolve internal and customer problems in a timely manner
Participate in process analysis and documentation of software development and production server environments
Provide feedback on specifications and designs
Accept candid feedback and look for areas of improvements

SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team
Willingness to learn, be mentored, and improve
Desire to contribute and improve design of DevOps services
Exceptional customer focus
Desire to teach other engineers about technology in area of expertise
Familiarity with of least one software development tool set such as Java, C# or scripting language
Aptitude for writing software programs or scripts

Qualifications

Student currently enrolled in classes leading to a degree in a computer science, engineering or related discipline
Relevant course in programming, mathematics, database, software design and architectures
Projects undertaken that demonstrates problem solving and research capabilities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Following skills are desired but not required:

Languages: Java, JavaScript, Python, SQL
Platforms: Linux Administration, AWS (or other Cloud Platforms), VMWare
Tools: Git, Kubernetes, Docker, Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Wireshark, Jenkins, Atlassian
Frameworks: Agile SDLC, versioning and release management processes

Job Description:

Leidos is offering a remote AI/ML Summer 2022 Internship out of our Arlington, VA office (virtual).


This position is for an intern that is motivated to learn quickly. The candidate should be familiar with Python and have significant experience with numpy, pandas, matplotlib, Scikit Learn, Keras, Tensorflow and/or Pytorch.


The candidate must be intellectually adaptive, inquisitive, good at expressing their needs, and self-managed when necessary. Selected candidates with work alongside junior and senior software/system engineers and research/data scientists with expertise in multi-modal information retrieval, UI development, computer vision, metrics, information science, artificial intelligence, and autonomous systems. The applied nature of this research will ensure the hard work of the AI/ML Summer Resident will have impacts across the entire Leidos community and the mission critical applications they serve.


Primary Responsibilities- Create AI/ML prototypes for use cases requiring identifying entity/objects, determining object association, object disambiguation, anomaly detection, state estimations, etc.- Develop and maintain data models (both physical and logical)- Perform extraction, transform, and load (ETL) tasks related to the different modalities and algorithms being applied. This data ETL includes identifying the data’s relevant metadata to ensure consistency, quality, accuracy, integrity, and information assurance and security.- Conduct anomaly detection using various AI/ML techniques- Use algorithms to identify complex patterns across multiple modalities- Increase the efficiency and quality data alignment and fusion- Enhance and maintain analysis tools, including automation of current processes using AI/ML algorithms- Direct quantitative data analysis including developing retrieval, processing, fusion, analysis, and visualization of various datasets- Configure and program prototypes Jupyter notebooks with ML solutions- Setup and use AWS instances to train and operate AI/ML models




Basic Qualifications- Pursuing a Bachelor or Master’s Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Mathematics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Engineering - Must be eligible to obtain a DoD Top Secret security clearance with polygraph- U.S. Citizenship required- Practical experience with deep learning model creation/deployment - Intermediate software development skills including developing and maintaining code bases- Hands-on Software Development Skills (Python-Preferred)- Experience or educational courses/projects in Machine Learning




Preferred Qualifications - Hands-on experience with prototype development- Hands-on experience with automating data cleansing, formatting, staging, and transformation


- Hands-on experience reading and replicating code/ideas from published academic papers- Hands-on experience applying data analytics- Hands-on experience with intelligent systems and machine learning- Experience with interpretability of deep learning models


- Experience in deep learning approaches to computer vision and/or natural language processing
