position: Computer Science / Computer Engineer Co-op (Data Science/Machine Vision)
description:
Overview:

Hunter Engineering Company is a global leader in the development and manufacturing of computer based automotive service equipment. Hunterâ€™s award-winning research and development team of engineers is responsible for hundreds of patented and exclusive features on our equipment.   We are in search of a student studying Computer Science or Computer Engineering interested in Data Science.

Job Summary

 

This position is primarily responsible for the research and development of various features based on Machine Learning.   Students work primarily on a Windows PC with Python.   Much of the actual machine learning training is done on a Linux machine.   There is a lot of real world data from Hunter equipment making this a unique Data Science job.

Responsibilities:

The individual will be involved in a variety of projects which may include:

 

  • Test and evaluate machine learning models
  • Data annotation and manipulation
  • Create and use PowerShell and Python scripts to acquire and organize data.
  • Create and use VBA scripts in Excel as part of data evaluation.
  • Create and use Python programs to clean and evaluate data.
  • Work with source control tools like Microsoft TFS and GIT to save and control data.
  • Annotate data used for training an ML model.   An example annotation program would be the use of Microsoft VoTT to identify and tag objects in images.
  • Document frequently used processes such that someone else might be able to complete related tasks.
  • Update training, test, and validation data used for a specific ML model as the data changes.
  • Work with an AI platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Configure and use a Linux PC to shorten ML model training times.
  • Experiment with ML models and data to improve final results.
  • Software design and testing
Qualifications:

 

What to Expect

It will be our intent and purpose to provide the individual with real world experience, which includes assisting in the progression of a product from concept stage to production. The work done by co-ops in this position is applied to actual Hunter products. The work is normally very individualized even if you are working in a larger group.   We host many co-ops annually.   Our goal is to provide an experience that will be an important, effective first step in the career of a future engineer.

 

Also visit our website for testimonials from previous co-ops
https://www.hunter.com/about-us/careers/co-op/

Qualifications

  • Minimum 3.0 GPA (must be on resume)
  • Major study in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
  • At least some programming experience
  • Excellent communication skills.

position: United in STEM: SAS Diversity Internship Program, Neurodivergent (Summer 2022)
description:
United in STEM: SAS Diversity Internship Program, Neurodivergent (Summer 2022)

 

Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker – always asking, “What if?” 

 

If so, then you may be the new team member we’re looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters – whether you’re developing algorithms, creating customer experiences or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless. 

 

What we do: 

 

We’re the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live. 

 

We believe diversity and inclusion is multi-dimensional – we have a culture that blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives from 59 countries around the world.  A diverse workforce brings together unique talents and abilities that inspire teams to create software that can change the world. Great minds don’t always think alike, so we make it a priority to promote an environment where varied perspectives are encouraged. 

 

Our award-winning program is designed to provide a valuable work experience for current autistic students who are passionate about technology and eager to make an impact. 

 

This job posting is for current students who identify as neurodivergent (those who identify with having a less-typical, cognitive variation, including but not limited to Autism, ADD, Dyslexia, etc) and enrolled in an accredited degree program who are passionate about technology and eager to make an impact. The goal of our internship program is to provide the opportunity to work in an inclusive work environment, receive mentorship and coaching, and to make meaningful contributions to our organization. We’re proud to share that the SAS Intern Program was named one of the 100 best internship programs in the United States for 2021! WayUp’s panel of industry expert judges and public votes, selected us to join the list of top intern programs. Click here to view the list.

 

What you’ll do: 

 

You’ll partner with some of the brightest minds in the world on business-critical projects, and you’ll have the opportunity to be immersed in our award-winning culture, grow your social and professional network, interact with our senior leadership, and share your contributions with the company. 

 

The internship experience will have three components – training and onboarding, mentorship and professional development, and meaningful on-the-job work experience. This will be a full-time paid summer internship of approximately 35 – 40 hours per week. 

 

What we’re looking for: 

  • Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university seeking a degree in a technical / quantitative course of study (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science/ Analytics, Information Systems, Economics, etc).
  • Programming experience with Java, C, C++, Python, or other programming languages.
  • Students must not be graduating prior to the beginning of the summer internship and must be enrolled to return to school after the entire internship ends (graduating in or after December 2022).
  • Must be capable of working in a collaborative team environment.
  • Able to work full-time 35-40 hours per week throughout the summer from May 2022 until August 2022, with a graduation date of December 2022 or later.

In order to work at SAS, you must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If there is a medical or religious reason preventing you from receiving an available COVID-19 vaccination, and you are selected as a candidate for consideration, we have an accommodations process in place to evaluate those requests. 

 

This is a pipeline requisition. By applying to this opportunity, you are expressing your interest and qualifications for the position. You will be notified in the Fall of 2021 if you are under consideration for open positions. 

 

Once you apply to this application, we will provide regular status updates to all applicants on a rolling basis. Based on your prior experiences and interests, your resume will be shared with hiring managers across SAS. This will then determine who you interview with during the selection process. During the selection and interview process, you’ll have the opportunity to learn more about the team you may work on. You can view a list of example positions below. By applying to this opportunity, you understand that you may be considered for any of these positions below. 

  • Software Developer
  • Software Developer in Test Engineer
  • UI/ UX Design
  • Machine Learning
  • Analytics

Click here to read more about SAS’ commitment to supporting and enabling people of all abilities. 

 

Timeline & Process 

  • Application Deadline: Friday, October 15
  • Interviews:Process begins mid-October and continues on a rolling basis.
  • Based on your background and experience, your application will be shared with hiring managers across numerous teams. This will determine which teams you interview with during the selection process.  
  • Step 1: Recorded  Virtual Interview (HireVue). Review this blog to learn more about it.  
  • Step 2: Final Interview: The final interview will be a Virtual Live Interview, approximately 60 minutes in length. You'll receive a specific job description for the role you are interviewing for, and you'll have the opportunity to learn about the team you may work on. 
  • Hear from a past Intern about the hiring process: Review here 
  • Internship Start Dates: May 17, 2022
  • Internship End Date: August 5, 2022

Additional Information 

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more:Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law. Also view the supplementEEO is the Law, and the Pay Transparency notice. 

 

Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process. 

 

All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com. SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action.

Overview

TDS, a Fortune 1000 national communications company, has a great opportunity for a Business Intelligence (BI) Intern. This internship provides the unique opportunity to learn about the inter-workings of a large IT organization, along with offering the ability to participate in job shadows, community volunteerism, and employee resource groups (ERG’s) - a student favorite being the Intern Employee Resource Group (ERG). The Intern ERG provides networking opportunities and exposure to Enterprise senior leaders. If you are driven and passionate with the desire to learn, come join and add value to our IT organization! 

 

Duration and Work Schedule

This internship is in our Middleton, WI office and will be full-time (40 hrs/week) from May through August 2022. There may be an opportunity to stay on part-time during the academic school year of 2022-2023 depending on academic schedule and business needs. Core business hours are 7:45am – 4:30pm Monday through Friday. Start and end dates are flexible.

 

Due to current conditions we support virtual work until it is safe to return to the office.

Responsibilities

What opportunities does this internship offer?

 

As a Business Intelligence Intern, you will be mentored by subject matter experts on responsibilities depending on the team and role you are assigned.

 

This position will help develop and support BI solutions in partnership with our customers. The BI Intern will support a broad base of internal customers ranging from accounting to engineering to shared services, and more. Work may include report and dashboard development, analytics, requirements gathering, and potentially predictive modeling & data visualization projects.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications: 

  • Currently pursuing an Associates or Bachelor’s Degree in information systems, computer science, programming or related field
  • Two or more semesters of related technology coursework 

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Exposure to or knowledge of ERP Systems, SAP preferred
  • Ability to research current and emerging information technologies
  • Some knowledge of software development life cycle
  • Knowledge of Relational Database Management System concepts and SQL
  • Proficiency with MS Office, specifically SharePoint, Excel and Access
  • Strong technical aptitude, initiative, creativity, and excellent customer service skills
  • Strong analytical problem-solving skills and critical thinking
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, including strong verbal and written communication
  • Ability to plan and organize multiple tasks
  • Solid work ethic and demonstrated ability to meet deadlines
  • Ability to work both independently and on team assignments
  • Must be assertive, proactive, and seek work and clarification on issues/concerns that arise
  • Self-motivated with the ability to act independently and demonstrate sound judgment
  • Dependable, accountable, responsive, and committed to follow-through activities

#TDS provides wireless; cable and wireline broadband, TV and voice; and hosted and managed services to approximately 5.8 million customers nationwide through its business units, U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions, BendBroadband and Suttle-Straus.

 

To learn more about this internship or our company, please visit tds.jobs. 

 

EEO

+ Pursuing an advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Master’s or PhD studies in Analytics, Engineering, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Statistics, etc.) with an expected graduation of December 2022 or Spring/Summer 2023

+ Strong technical and analytical skillset required: experience with Microsoft BI, Tableau, SAS, Stata, R, Python, SQL, or Alteryx required; familiarity with Excel and PowerPoint preferred



+ Core mathematical ability to understand, utilize and innovate on state-of-the art machine learning algorithms and/or statistical modeling

+ Ability to project plan, lead, execute and deliver compelling and impactful user research in a face-paced environment, balancing rigor and speed

+ Prior experience synthesizing and packaging complex analyses and delivering results to non-technical audiences including senior leadership teams

+ Proven ability to use strategic tools and frameworks to analyze complex strategic problems, develop clear recommendations and present findings

+ Proven ability to sift through data, identify critical information, develop hypotheses, perform rigorous analyses, and make recommendations to broader audiences



+ Demonstrated ability to use data to influence decision making. Strong project management experience managing multiple project streams and complexity

+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including superior presentation skills

+ Strong interpersonal skills and open to learning new tools/techniques

+ Passionate about Sport, Nike products and the consumer/retail industry



Preferred qualifications:



+ 2+ years of experience in a role developing predictive or explanatory models and/or experimentation processes

+ Experience with neural nets and deep architectures preferred

+ Experience with moderate to large-scale data sets (>100GB) preferred

+ Previous experience in working in a product management capacity for data science product

+ Expertise in at least one production-quality programming languages (e.g. java, python, scala, C++)



Please submit your resume as a PDF!



We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.



Nike Analytics encompasses multiple teams across the enterprise. As a Nike Data Science & Advanced Analytics intern, you will be responsible for assessing and analyzing data, building predictive models, and delivering valuable insights to key stakeholders across the business. We want to make every Nike decision better because of data! Data Science interns will have the opportunity to work on one of the teams described below.


Consumer Insights:


+ Marketing Science:



The Marketing Science team is responsible for building and deepening a holistic view of Nike’s consumers through data and analytics and applying those insights to inform the development of incredible content & experiences for our consumers. We use consumer knowledge and marketing science to understand our consumers and what marketing channels, content and attributes resonate best with them, combining science with the art of Nike’s marketing.



+ Consumer Data Science:



The Consumer Data Science team applies consumer insights to personalize and optimize incredible digital services and experiences for our consumers. As a CDS intern, you will be responsible for helping us build the next generation of personalized experiences that power many of our digital channels delivering direct and unbreakable relationships with hundreds of millions of our customers.



+ Nike Direct Analytics:



The Nike Direct Analytics teams are responsible for supporting the strategic decision-making of Nike Direct leadership. We provide holistic, omnichannel, consumer-centric analytics and insights, utilizing data from across our ecosystem and supporting initiatives that span global, geo, and functional teams to drive business growth.


Commercial Analytics:


+ Global Sourcing & Manufacturing Analytics:



Global Souring & Manufacturing teams dream up new ways to make better-performing products faster and more efficiently. This world-class team challenges assumptions about how our products are made and leads the company in pursuing results-oriented sustainability goals — all while producing Nike’s rich mix of product. Manufacturing and Engineering works closely with design teams, categories, manufacturing partners, material suppliers and logistics providers across more than 40 countries on six continents. They navigate complex geopolitics with multiple supply chains and diverse ecosystems while remaining focused on manufacturing, materials, sustainability and product quality.



+ Demand & Supply Management Analytics:



Consumer demand is Nike demand. We'll get the right product into the hands of the consumer faster through end-to-end demand and supply management fueled by consistent data and advanced analytics. We'll drive marketplace health and mutual profitability by delivering insights to help our business partners manage supply and inventory investments and drive to a better forecast of demand in the marketplace.



+ Global Operations & Logistics Analytics:



Nike’s Operations team ensures that every year over one billion pieces of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right destination on time across the globe. The complex process involves 60+ distribution nodes, thousands of accounts, and over 100,000 retail doors. The team constantly pushes to become faster, more efficient, more reliable, and more flexible, while minimizing its environmental impact, to support changing consumer needs.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, or disability. NIKE is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please call +1 503-671-4156 and let us know the nature of your request, your location and your contact information.

position: USA - Assurance - Assurance 10x Accelerator - Intern - Summer 2022
description:
USA - Assurance - Assurance 10x Accelerator - Intern - Summer 2022
 
173961
 
GA-Atlanta, TX-Dallas, NJ-Hoboken, TX-Houston
 

 
**________**
 

 
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
 

 
**_________**
 

 
**Assurance Accelerator – DnA Specialist - Intern**
 

 
**Location(s):** Houston and San Jose
 

 
**What if your career could have a lasting impact on you, and on the world?**
 

 
Here at EY, you’ll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We’ll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you’ll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future – all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond.
 

 
**The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.**
 

 
**The opportunity: your next adventure awaits**
 

 
Join our audit innovation lab and you will work with our assurance teams and world-class clients to leverage leading edge technologies to find creative, technology driven solutions to our everyday client work, and where you will feel and see your impact.
 

 
As a DnA Specialist, you’ll be joined by an entrepreneurial team of multidisciplinary professionals in role which focuses on collecting, combining and exploring data to create insights that support our clients with their decision-making processes. You will improve our clients’ data integrity and quality to allow for more reliable reports and insights within the accounting, finance, governance and regulatory space and pursue automation in the process to create efficiencies.
 

 
This is the perfect role for you to get heavily involved from day one and help the practice grow. You can make an immediate impact doing great work exceeding client expectations. If you’re looking to achieve your career ambitions and explore/train in new technologies for continued growth, there are exciting opportunities for you and the team at EY.
 

 
**Your key responsibilities**
 

 
Business is constantly evolving, and disruption in our working world calls for an innovative approach to how we work. At EY, we are leveraging emerging technologies including analytics, robotics, drones and machine learning to better enable a quality audit. We are also redefining our workforce to be more agile and adaptable, with greater diversity in backgrounds including more technical skills beyond accounting. Our workforce will continue to be enabled through technology to support virtual teams and digital elements, such as bots.
 

 
So what does this approach mean for you? It will allow you to perform more high-level thinking and technology-related tasks. You can work with diverse individuals and focus on innovation.
 

 
You also will experience greater global connectivity and be able to demonstrate leadership and align with a purpose. You will find this shift exciting and more rewarding and see the auditor as even more relevant in building trust in the capital markets.
 

 
**What we look for**
 

 
· **You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset** . What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world.
 

 
· **You are curious and purpose driven** . We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world.
 

 
· **You are inclusive** . We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust.
 

 
· **Qualifications** .
 

 
+ Be working towards an undergraduate degree in computer science, computer engineering, data analysis, statistics, financial mathematics, or another related field
 
+ Advanced proficiency in Excel and SQL; An interest in data analytics tools including, but not limited to Python, Tableau, R, Alteryx, Hadoop, Spark, Microsoft BI, JavaScript, D3.js, etc, and emerging technologies (Blockchain, Internet- of Things, Robotic Process Automation, virtual reality headsets, 3-D printers, drones, satellite imagery, etc.)
 
+ The ability and willingness to travel and work in excess of standard hours when necessary
 
+ A driver’s license valid in the U.S.
 

 
**What’s in it for you**
 

 
· Accelerate your technical capabilities and transformative leadership skills with future-focused courses and development programs.
 

 
· Broaden your horizons by working on highly integrated teams across the globe and collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds — both professionally and culturally.
 

 
· Bring out the best in yourself with continuous investment in your personal well-being and career development.
 

 
· Develop your own personal purpose and help us create a positive ripple effect on our teams, our business, clients and society – building a better working world, together.
 

 
· If you join EY full-time after your internship, we offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
 

 
**What you can expect**
 

 
· Our approach to hiring utilizes several different formats throughout the course of the recruiting process.
 

 
· In addition to speaking with our recruiters and client-serving professionals, we also leverage game-based assessments to assess your non-technical skills and attributes in a quick and engaging experience. This includes your collaboration style and your abilities to work with information and the use of pre-recorded video interviews (PRVI). PRVI technology provides a great opportunity for you to share more about your qualifications and interests, as well as to ask more specifics about EY and the role for which you are interviewing. It also provides you with the flexibility and convenience of completing at a time and place that works best for your schedule.
 

 
· Additional interviews may be in the form of a live interview, either via video or in-person.
 

 
For applicants for jobs in our Denver office, EY complies with Colorado laws and regulations. Information can be foundhere (https://csgexternal.ey.com/2019/1904-3123308/colorado-undergraduate-compensation.pdf) .
 

 
**__________**
 

 
**What we offer**
 

 
If you join EY full-time after your internship, we offer a competitive compensation package where you'll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you'll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You'll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
 

 
+ Continuous learning: You'll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
 
+ Success as defined by you: We'll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
 
+ Transformative leadership: We'll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
 
+ Diverse and inclusive culture: You'll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
 

 
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
 

 
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
 

 
**EY | Building a better working world**
 

 
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
 

 
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
 

 
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
 

 
EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Assurance

Responsibilities

Technology powers everything we do at T-Mobile. We need our product managers, developers, and engineers to have outstanding teamwork to bring exciting technology. Are you innovative, customer driven, and interested in becoming part of the Un-carrier? We would love you to join our teams to share your innovative ideas and perspectives that will impact the future of Technology!

The TechX Internship program is a paid 9-month, part-time learning experience that begins in October for students currently enrolled in a full-time undergraduate degree program, majoring in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Data Management, IT or another Technology-related field. Work closely with our teams, be paired with a mentor, and participate in projects alongside with some of the best senior technologists in the industry. For our eager explorers, you’ll also have the opportunity to rotate teams giving you exposure to a wide variety of technologies across our organization. We encourage you to be a TechX Intern with our Technology Team!

The Cybersecurity Engineer Intern will help ensure that our software, systems and infrastructure are crafted and implemented to the highest security standards. They will work with an Information Security Manager to analyze the cybersecurity controls for the containerized/cloud based deployments. The Associate will become familiar with the Center for Internet Security Cyber Security Controls and how to apply to containerized/cloud based deployments. Performs technical security assessments, code reviews and vulnerability testing to highlight risk and re-mediate associated findings while helping T-Mobile teams and partners improve. Works closely with other T-Mobile Engineers and associates to craft and build proactive methods to improve our security posture.

Working toward a Bachelor’s Degree, in Computer Science, Business Administration, Project Management or combination of equivalent experience and education

Supports cybersecurity review and examination of new technologies, modifications to existing technologies, and systems/application designs. Provides appropriate cybersecurity gap remediation guidance.
Maintains documentation on security requirements and recommendations/guidance for cybersecurity issue(s)
Develops transparency inside & outside of cybersecurity. Collaborate with groups such as application support, engineering ops, finance, privacy, risk management, and other DSO teams, as appropriate
Keeps updated documentation for security policy lifecycle throughout, including cybersecurity intake requests, documentation in support of intake requests, review, approval, implementation, publishing, and communication to requester(s). Communicates accordingly to partners at each of the steps for the cybersecurity request.
May participate in security, compliance, and risk assessments on projects throughout project lifecycle
Supports peers with security projects driven by groups both internal and external to info security
Also, responsible for other Duties/Projects as assigned by management as needed.
Ability to produce high quality detailed documentation and process flow diagrams
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely with technical and non-technical staff
Basic understanding of cyber security fundamentals (e.g., common attack techniques, vulnerability types, OWASP Top 10…etc.)
Proficiency in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio)
Scripting or programming skills using Python, Perl, or similar

At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

We are looking for exceptional individuals interested in working at intersection of big data analytics and EDA in an internship position. Primary responsibilities include researching and developing data platform components and applications in EDA and adjacent markets. You will work with a worldwide cross-functional team and collaborate to find innovative and practical solutions.

Qualifications

·       Pursuing MS or PhD in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering

·       Experience working with big data, such as Hadoop ecosystem, Spark, Kafka, etc.

·       In-depth understanding of data structures, algorithms, and distributed systems

·       Development experience in Python, Java, or Scala

·       Understanding of database fundamentals and familiarity with SQL

·       Familiar with working in Linux-based environments

·       Excellent verbal and written communication skills

We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

15000 Valmont Plaza Omaha Nebraska 68154

Why Valmont
 

Welcome to Valmont, where a world of opportunity awaits. When you join our team, you become part of a passionate group dedicated to changing lives and conserving resources around the globe. We want problem solvers who roll up their sleeves to foster progress and innovation for all people. At Valmont, we provide infrastructure, irrigation, tubing and coatings to the world. We strengthen cities. We nourish croplands. We design, manufacture and coat. Our products and services make a difference. Join us, and BUILD YOUR WORLD.

A Brief Summary of This Position:

Valmont is currently seeking a highly motivated and talented individual for an internship position in the Corporate Information Technology Department. We are looking for a highly driven individual that will be responsible for assisting with projects involving engineering, administration, and management of network systems in the global enterprise network.

Valmont’s internship program mission is to provide a hands-on learning experience through project work, leadership development, job shadowing and interaction with senior leadership.

Essential Functions:

  • Develop and maintain Information Technology operational processes and tasks.
  • Communicate with telecommunications vendors to obtain pricing and technical specifications for available hardware, software, or services.
  • Collaborate with systems staff to ensure smooth and reliable operation of software and systems for fulfilling business objectives and processes.
  • Work with personnel and facilities management staff to install, remove, or relocate user connectivity equipment and devices
  • Perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.
  • Conduct research on software and network products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts.
  • Monitor, analyze, and predict trends for network equipment performance, resource allocation, and data bandwidth utilization growth to recommend enhancements to the IT management team.
  • Perform ongoing hardware and software maintenance operations, including installing or upgrading hardware or software.
  • Establish functional or system standards to ensure operational requirements, quality requirements, and design constraints are addressed.
  • Create required reports in response to business user needs.
  • Create or update technical documentation for network installations or changes to existing installations.
  • Design and perform network audits, device configuration backup procedures, and other recovery processes in accordance with the company’s disaster recovery and business continuity strategies.

Required Qualifications of Every Candidate (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities):

  • Sophomore, Junior, or Senior standing pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications, Management Information Systems, or another relevant degree
  • Highly effective communication skills, both written and oral
  • Energetic and self-motivated team player with ability to work effectively and cooperatively with project and infrastructure teams
  • Strong working knowledge of proactive and auto-corrective monitoring practices

Benefits:

  • Great opportunity to gain career related course work experience from an industry leader
  • Paid Internship – Valmont values you
  • Potential development into a regular full-time position
  • Flexible full-time day shift hours during the summer
  • A thriving culture in a growing business
  • Interactive group activities with intern peers

Working Environment and Physical Efforts:

Work is typically performed in an office setting.  The incumbent is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time, as well as talk and listen on the phone and in personal conversations or meetings.    Environment is fast paced and demanding most of the time.  No travel requirements for this position.  The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms while working in the office with various files and forms and while working on the computer.  The employee is occasionally required to move about the office.  Incumbent must utilize proper ergonomic safeguards such as monitor height and positions, keyboard location and height and proper wrists rests. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds in working with large files, binders, and computer equipment.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and depth perception.

Valmont does not discriminate against any employee or applicant in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.  Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

If you have a disability and require any assistance in filling out the application for employment email EEOCompliance@Valmont.com.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

There are 2 engineering teams in our office, as described below. Our interview is a general interview in consideration for a role in either team. If you join either team, you will work alongside engineers from the top universities and tech companies in the world, hands-on with the code from day one.

Team #1 - Consulting engineering

Yext Consulting is looking for Full Stack Software Engineers to join a fast-paced, cross-functional team working to deliver customized Yext products for our largest enterprise customers. Consulting SWEs work with engagement managers and designers to deliver customized Yext Pages, Data Integrations, Dashboards, and other solutions for Fortune 500 level clients. Our tech stack includes Closure Templates (soy), SCSS, ES6 JavaScript, Node.js, Go, and Java. We take pride in our ability to tackle any engineering challenge and keep pace with the ever-changing needs of our clients and the market. We value engineers that have a passion for technology (particularly front end development), display a willingness to jump in, and are excited to be part of a cross-functional, client-facing team.

What You'll Do

  • Build customized, high-quality consumer-facing web applications while ensuring compatibility across multiple browsers and platforms
  • Augment development tooling to improve engineering quality-of-life, automation, iteration speed, and maintainability using modern technologies like Go, Node.js, Grunt, Webpack, SASS, and more
  • Write clean, tested, and well-documented code
  • Proactively contribute ideas for new features and identify areas for improvement
  • Collaborate effectively across teams, including outside of engineering
  • Effectively communicate technical concepts including architectures, best practices, implementation options, compatibility issues and tradeoffs to fellow engineers and non-technical stakeholders alike.

What You Have

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related technical field, graduating between December 2022 and August 2023
  • Familiar with at least one of the following languages: Java, Python, Go, C++, or JavaScript
  • Ability to easily move between backend and frontend technologies
  • Openness to new technologies and creative solutions
  • Comfortable working within a fast-paced high growth environment
  • Contribution to open source projects

Team #2 - Technology engineering

We’re looking for Software Engineers to join the Yext Engineering team and drive the technology behind our revolutionary product offering! Our team works in an agile environment running two-week sprints that culminate with demos of features in progress. You will work alongside engineers from the top universities and tech companies in the world, hands-on with the code from day one.

What You'll Do

  • Participate in full life-cycle software development
  • Design, implement, and deploy highly distributed and scalable systems
  • Contribute ideas for new features and identify areas for improvement proactively
  • Immerse yourself into the Yext culture and ecosystem by following our engineering motto: “Think Big, Learn Fast, and Get Stuff Done”

What You Have

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, graduating between December 2022 and August 2023
  • Excellent implementation skills in a OOP language (We mostly use Java and Go)
  • Fast learner who picks up new technologies quickly
  • Ability to work productively in a collaborative team environment
  • Comfortable working within a fast-paced environment

We believe that cultivating a deeper sense of loyalty and belonging is key to how we attract and retain our best people. By embracing our diverse experiences and views, we are better positioned to deliver results, create innovations that matter, and thrive in today’s changing world. This reality inspires our Inclusion & Diversity vision, We Are More Together, and guides our approach as we all work toward creating great places where our teams work and thrive.







We are seeking interns for our dynamic Engineering team this summer. Our intern teams work on projects that help improve development processes and product quality within Tektronix. Internships at Tek embrace continuous improvement, technical expertise, and the adoption and usage of the best industry engineering development practices.



As a Tek Intern, you will have the opportunity to work with a group of creative and dedicated Engineers who make test and measurement equipment that enables all of today’s technological advancements to occur. You will be part of a cohort of Interns working on specific projects that impact our global strategy, while getting mentorship and support from Senior Engineers, SME’s and Mentors who have produced award winning, leading edge oscilloscope products.



Tek Interns are a critical part of the future of Tektronix and technology. Join our program this year for opportunities to network, learn, and build your future in engineering.




Required:





+ Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate Engineering program at an accredited University



+ Minimum of 2 years in an engineering program such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Electrical Engineering





Preferred:





+ Good technical documentation skills



+ Strong analytic and problem-solving skills



+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills



+ A passion for continuous process improvement



+ Applicable technical skills like:



+ C++, Python, C#



+ Networking



+ Software Security



+ Signal Processing



+ Embedded systems, FPGAs



+ Experience with oscilloscopes















When you join Tektronix and Fortive, you will work in an extraordinary team, learning with and from great people, where diversity and inclusion is celebrated. You will have the opportunity to do work that makes a difference in the world. You will be trusted and empowered to contribute in meaningful ways with visibility and accountability. We are obsessed with our customers and have a commitment to transparency, unending learning and growth to accelerate progress and innovation. Join us for the excitement of a startup with a history of success! For You. For Us. For Growth.

position: Cigna Technology Early Career Development Program (TECDP) - Summer Intern 2022 (Evergreen)
description:
Cigna Technology Early Career Development Program (TECDP) Summer Intern


Start date/year: May 2022


Duration: 12 weeks


Locations: Bloomfield, CT | St. Louis, MO l Philadelphia, PA | Denver, CO | Franklin Lakes, NJ l Nashville, TN | Austin, TX | Bloomington, MN


Work Authorization: This role is open only to individuals who are eligible for employment in the United States and who would not require visa sponsorship now OR in the future.


*Housing is available for summer interns who live more than 25 miles from their assigned office.


This role is located onsite which expects most work to be performed at a Cigna office location, but may allow for some work to be performed at home. Employees must be fully vaccinated if they choose to come onsite. Currently, due to the pandemic, we are encouraging all employee to remain working from home and all onsite meetings require a virtual option. However, we expect that this role will likely return to being performed primarily at an office location.


Why a career with Cigna Technology?


Cigna is a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being, and peace of mind of those we serve by making health care simple, affordable, and predictable. Due to the rapidly changing environment and Cigna's growing businesses, we are seeking the best and brightest minds to join our technology team to help develop and support the future state of our technology solutions.


Do you have a passion for technology?


Cigna Technology is looking for technology-focused individuals to join the Technology Early Career Development Program (TECDP) summer internship program. The TECDP mission is to support the professional development needs of early career technology associates and interns, as well as early career talent requirements by providing interns with challenging technology assignments, formalized training and guided mentorship. The committed partnership between interns, TECDP program management and Cigna's Technology leaders is a testament to the program’s value and the critical role it plays in developing Cigna's future technology professionals.


The TECDP summer internship offers students interested in technology an opportunity to engage in a challenging professional work experience. The internship is designed to further develop an individual’s technical skills aligned to their interests. The TECDP program manager will work with interns to determine the best role for them prior to starting. In addition to their role work, interns will have the opportunity to participate in a technology innovations project which seeks to solve a real-world technology challenge. The ideal candidate is someone who has a desire to help others and a passion for technology.


Opportunities for interns are available across all of Cigna’s Technology organizations. Our interns are treated as full-time program associates and this opportunity could lead to a full-time employment offer following graduation.


Summer Internship Opportunities (include but are not limited to):


+ Application Developer

+ Software Engineer

+ Cloud Engineer

+ Infrastructure Engineer

+ Network Engineer

+ Product Owner

+ Scrum Master

+ Release Train Engineer

+ Business or Systems Analyst

+ Project Manager

+ Information Protection Specialist

+ Software Engineer

+ Data Analyst


Qualifications:


Internship candidates must be pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in a technical program at time of hire. Desired degrees include, but are not limited to, Computer Science and Computer Science Engineering, Software Engineering, Cybersecurity, Data Science. Degrees related to business technology disciplines such as Management Information Systems, Computer Information Systems, and Business Information Systems may be considered based on depth of technology experience. A working knowledge of coding and programming basics is required.


Other desired competencies:


+ Clearly and effectively exchange information, ideas, facts, and perspectives with persons inside and outside of an organization

+ Build and maintain collaborative relationships to work effectively toward common goals, while appreciating diverse viewpoints and shared responsibilities

+ Identify and respond to needs based upon an understanding of situational context and logical analysis of relevant information

+ Recognize and capitalize on personal and team strengths to achieve organizational goals

+ Proactively develop oneself and one’s career through continual personal and professional learning, awareness of one’s strengths and weaknesses, navigation of career opportunities, and networking to build relationships within and without one’s organization

+ Understand and leverage technologies ethically to enhance efficiencies, complete tasks, and accomplish goals

+ 3.2 or better overall GPA preferred


A goal of this internship program is to prepare and identify qualified candidates for future roles within Cigna post-graduation. Therefore, this temporary internship is open only to individuals who are eligible for employment in the United States and who would not require visa sponsorship now or in the future.


For this position in Colorado, we anticipate offering an hourly rate of 16.00, +/- 10%, depending on experience.


About Cigna


Cigna Corporation exists to improve lives. We are a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. Together, with colleagues around the world, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation. position: United in STEM: SAS Diversity Internship Program, Students of Color (Summer 2022)
description:
United in STEM: SAS Diversity Internship Program, Students of Color (Summer 2022)

 

Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker – always asking, “What if?” 

 

If so, then you may be the new team member we’re looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters – whether you’re developing algorithms, creating customer experiences or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless. 

 

What we do: 

 

We’re the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live. 

 

We believe diversity and inclusion is multi-dimensional – we have a culture that blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives from 59 countries around the world.  A diverse workforce brings together unique talents and abilities that inspire teams to create software that can change the world. Great minds don’t always think alike, so we make it a priority to promote an environment where varied perspectives are encouraged. 

 

This program is for current students who identify as Black or African American, Latinx, Indigenous, and other historically underrepresented students of color enrolled in an accredited degree program who are passionate about technology and eager to make an impact. The goal of our diversity internship program is to offer the opportunity to work in an inclusive work environment, receive mentorship and coaching, and to make meaningful contributions to our organization. We’re proud to share that the SAS Intern Program was named one of the 100 best internship programs in the United States for 2021! WayUp’s panel of industry expert judges and public votes, selected us to join the list of top intern programs. Click here to view the list.

 

What you’ll do: 

 

You’ll partner with some of the brightest minds in the world on business-critical projects, and you’ll have the opportunity to be immersed in our award-winning culture, grow your social and professional network, interact with our senior leadership, and share your contributions with the company. 

 

The internship experience will have three components – training and onboarding, mentorship and professional development, and meaningful on-the-job work experience during the summer.

 

What we’re looking for: 

  • Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university seeking a degree in a technical / quantitative course of study (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, etc.).
  • Programming experience with Java, C, C++, Python, or other programming languages.
  • Students must not be graduating prior to the beginning of the summer internship and must be enrolled to return to school after the entire internship ends (graduating in or after December 2022).
  • Must be capable of working in a collaborative office environment.
  • Able to work full-time 35-40 hours per week throughout the summer from May 2022 until August 2022, with a graduation date of December 2022 or later.

In order to work at SAS, you must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If there is a medical or religious reason preventing you from receiving an available COVID-19 vaccination, and you are selected as a candidate for consideration, we have an accommodations process in place to evaluate those requests. 

 

This is a pipeline requisition. By applying to this opportunity, you are expressing your interest and qualifications for the position. You will be notified in the Fall of 2021 if you are under consideration for open positions. 

 

Once you apply to this application, we will provide regular status updates to all applicants on a rolling basis. Based on your prior experiences and interests, your resume will be shared with hiring managers across SAS. This will then determine who you interview with during the selection process. During the selection and interview process, you’ll have the opportunity to learn more about the team you may work on. You can view a list of example positions below. By applying to this opportunity, you understand that you may be considered for any of these positions below. 

  • Software Developer
  • Software Developer in Test Engineer
  • UI/ UX Design
  • Machine Learning
  • Analytics

You can read more about SAS’ commitment to encouraging authenticity by embracing multiple cultures & identities by clicking here. 

 

Timeline & Process 

  • Application Deadline: Friday, October 15

  • Interviews: Process begins in Mid-October and continues on a rolling basis.
  • Based on your background and experience, your application will be shared with hiring managers across numerous teams. This will determine which teams you interview with during the selection process.  
  • Step 1: Recorded  Virtual Interview (HireVue). Review this blog to learn more about it.  
  • Step 2: Final Interview: The final interview will be a Virtual Live Interview, approximately 60 minutes in length. You'll receive a specific job description for the role you are interviewing for, and you'll have the opportunity to learn about the team you may work on. 
  • Hear from a past Intern about the hiring process: Review here 
  • Internship Start Dates: May 17, 2022
  • Internship End Date: August 5, 2022

 

Additional Information 

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more:Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law. Also view the supplementEEO is the Law, and the Pay Transparency notice. 

 

Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process. 

 

In order to work at SAS, you must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If there is a medical or religious reason preventing you from receiving an available COVID-19 vaccination, and you are selected as a candidate for consideration, we have an accommodations process in place to evaluate those requests. 

 

All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com. SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action.

Description



We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. Each person at Bell has a role in creating the technology and innovation that makes Bell an aviation expert. Our people in our business functions ensure the stability of our company by supporting the manufacturing and creation of our aircraft. No matter where you are in the company, at Bell, you are critical to the success of our company.



A Day in the Life of an Information Technology Intern



As an Information Technology Intern for Bell, you’ll be a part of the Technology team at our Global Headquarters in Fort Worth, TX. You’ll take part in a fast-paced internship which will consist of projects, activities and hands-on training to facilitate your learning. You’ll have the opportunity to engage with senior leaders and subject matter experts who will be mentoring and coaching you to success.

+ Observe and discuss business operations, team-working environment, leadership and management styles.

+ Shadow team members and supervisor to gain detailed insight to department operations.

+ Formulate alternative courses of actions and solicit feedback for professional development.

+ Collaborate with team members, management, and cross-functionally with other departments depending on the scope of the assignment(s).



Don’t miss the chance to join our team environment where you feel a sense of camaraderie. As a member of our global workforce, you will collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where unique experiences, backgrounds and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight.



Qualifications



Education Requirements :



+ Must be a current student enrolled in a university and pursuing a degree at the time of the Summer Intern Program.



- Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business strongly preferred.

+ Must have completed a minimum of 60 credit hours by the start of the internship, or have previous Bell work experience.

+ 3.0 minimum overall, undergraduate GPA is strongly preferred.



Minimum Requirements for an Information Technology Intern at Bell :



+ Good communication skills, both oral and written are required.

+ Quickly grasps new concepts when faced with unfamiliar tasks.

+ Good organizational and time management skills.

+ Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

+ Action oriented.

+ Must be able to fulfill the full length of the Summer Intern Program (May 25th–August 6th).



Ideal Candidates Also Have:



+ Any work experience demonstrating responsibility, work ethic, customer experience.

+ Personal discipline, interpersonal communication, leadership skills.

+ Passion for their role.

+ Professional associations.

+ Interest in the manufacturing industry.

Nike Analytics encompasses multiple teams across the enterprise. As a Nike Applied Analytics intern, you will be responsible for assessing and analyzing data, and delivering valuable insights to key stakeholders across the business. We want to make every Nike decision better because of data! As an intern, you will have the opportunity to work on one of the teams described below.


Consumer Insights:


+ Marketing Science:


The Marketing Science team is responsible for building and deepening a holistic view of Nike’s consumers through data and analytics and applying those insights to inform the development of incredible content & experiences for our consumers. We use consumer knowledge and marketing science to understand our consumers and what marketing channels, content and attributes resonate best with them, combining science with the art of Nike’s marketing.


+ Consumer Data Science:


The Consumer Data Science team applies consumer insights to personalize and optimize incredible digital services and experiences for our consumers. As a CDS intern, you will be responsible for helping us build the next generation of personalized experiences that power many of our digital channels delivering direct and unbreakable relationships with hundreds of millions of our customers.


+ Nike Direct Analytics:


The Nike Direct Analytics teams are responsible for supporting the strategic decision-making of Nike Direct leadership. We provide holistic, omnichannel, consumer-centric analytics and insights, utilizing data from across our ecosystem and supporting initiatives that span global, geo, and functional teams to drive business growth.


Commercial Analytics:


+ Global Sourcing & Manufacturing Analytics:


Global Souring & Manufacturing teams dream up new ways to make better-performing products faster and more efficiently. This world-class team challenges assumptions about how our products are made and leads the company in pursuing results-oriented sustainability goals — all while producing Nike’s rich mix of product. Manufacturing and Engineering works closely with design teams, categories, manufacturing partners, material suppliers and logistics providers across more than 40 countries on six continents. They navigate complex geopolitics with multiple supply chains and diverse ecosystems while remaining focused on manufacturing, materials, sustainability and product quality.


+ Demand & Supply Management Analytics:


Consumer demand is Nike demand. We'll get the right product into the hands of the consumer faster through end-to-end demand and supply management fueled by consistent data and advanced analytics. We'll drive marketplace health and mutual profitability by delivering insights to help our business partners manage supply and inventory investments and drive to a better forecast of demand in the marketplace.


+ Global Operations & Logistics Analytics:


Nike’s Operations team ensures that every year over one billion pieces of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right destination on time across the globe. The complex process involves 60+ distribution nodes, thousands of accounts, and over 100,000 retail doors. The team constantly pushes to become faster, more efficient, more reliable, and more flexible, while minimizing its environmental impact, to support changing consumer needs.

Responsibilities:

Every day, in nearly 100 countries around the world, millions of people depend on Daktronics scoring and display systems for information and entertainment. Our displays provide vital travel information in airports and train stations and along highways. They advertise the price of gas, store specials, and more as you make your daily commute. They also enhance spectatorsâ€™ experiences at sporting events of all kinds, from Little League to the major leagues.

 

At Daktronics, you will put your degree to the test using cutting edge technology to trouble shoot and test production code for high-end video processing used by real customers. As a Software Intern, you will write code to enhance existing Daktronics software components by adding features or tracking down and fixing bugs. You will actively engage in business transactions and experience the satisfaction of knowing that something that wasnâ€™t working yesterday is working for our customer today because of your software solutions and problem-solving skills. And sometimes, you will even see your work on national television!

 

Internship opportunities available:   January 10 â€“ August 12, 2022, or May 16 â€“ December 16, 2022.

 

What would I do?

As a Daktronics intern, you will work with a team of developers and professionals to design, develop, and deliver software solutions to various Daktronics customers and business groups. You will primarily focus on:

  • Application Development: Enhancement and maintenance of our current applications and solutions along with design and development of new software applications using Microsoft Visual Studio.
  • Programming Languages: A majority of work would be done in the C#, JavaScript, and Typescript software development languages.
  • Team Collaboration: Work within a larger development team to solve problems.
  • Testing and Documentation: Write unit tests for existing code along with assisting in the development of software product requirements and design documentation.
  • Perform other duties as assigned or needed to support the efforts of Daktronics.

View the  Day in the Life intern video.

 

Who are the Software Development teams at Daktronics?

Daktronics software teams that support everything from internal applications and tools to software solutions and products used by our customers. We are excited for the chance to bring someone on board these teams that cares deeply about growing professionally and challenging themselves. We are passionate about solving the right problems the right way. We challenge each other every day and expect the best from each other. We respect each other and those we work with very much while welcoming differing viewpoints and suggestions. We work hard & we have a lot of fun.
