Overview:

 

MTSI is seeking an Engineering Co-Op at our Dayton, Ohio  location. Modern Technology Solutions, Inc. (MTSI), is a fast-paced and dynamic 100% employee-owned and operated technology firm, providing leading-edge technical services in  flight test operations, ballistic missile and air defense, air vehicle survivability, unmanned aircraft, intelligence support, cyber, space, and homeland defense.    

 

We offer competitive compensation  with  comprehensive benefits, including attractive salaries, semi-annual bonuses, health insurance,  fully paid long/short term disability,  tuition reimbursement, immediate vesting in a matching 401(k)  and participation in our company funded EmployeeStockOwnership Plan.

 

Join an award winning team with a reputation for excellence.   MTSI is dedicated to taking ownership of our customers problems and delivering solutions.   We put employees first and are committed to their success.   MTSI has a track record of 27 years of consecutive growth.  

Responsibilities:

We're seeking a highly motivated engineering student for a paid internship in our Beavercreek, OH office to    

  • Review and understand Aircraft Avionics / EW specifications and standards
  • Support Requirements Validation / Verification activities.
  • Support requirements traceability for Air Force Training Systems (Simulators) programs.
  • Perform requirements upload and tracing in DOORS database.
  • Support system architecture development by researching baseline engineering products and technologies.
Qualifications:

Educational Requirements:  

  • Engineering student pursuing a degree in systems engineering, electrical engineering, software engineering, computer engineering, or computer science.
  • GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office products (specifically Excel, Word, and Visual Basic) is desired.    

Clearance Requirements:  

  • Ability to obtain/maintain a government security clearance.

Overview:

 

AVIAN is seeking a Model-Based Systems Engineer (MBSE) co-op student to develop and sustain MBSE models utilizing model-based engineering tools and practices to support customer requirements of enterprise systems engineering activities.  

 

AVIAN (pronounced *a-v-yin*) is an employee-owned, entrepreneurial-spirited company where creative, talented minds flourish, and where proactive, productive, proficient professionals feel valued.    

 

We are resourceful, responsive, and reachable for various government and commercial clients in program, financial, and logistics management; engineering and systems engineering; test and evaluation of manned and unmanned systems; workforce development and training; communication strategy and graphic design.    

 

The type of work we do is a direct result of the creativity of our team, and the talents they bring. But in the end, we are all driven by the purpose of taking care of those around us.    

Responsibilities:

Weâ€™re seeking people that are passionate and excited about creating well-crafted products and memorable experiences with our customers. We are not in the market of automated transactions; we build lasting relationships.  

 

You will work with a team to integrate analytic models and results with other enterprise tools to aid requirements definition, CONOPS development, architecture design, risk analysis, scheduling, change requests, verification, validation, and test.

 

You will gain broad Systems Engineering experience through formal training and informal job shadowing opportunities.   Where possible, you will be given specific tasking in support of customer requirements.   Your time will be focused on learning Model-Based Engineering applications and technology like SysML, CAMEO Systems Modeler and other collaborative software applications.   You will become proficient in the use of MBSE tools.

 

Must be a U.S. citizen pursuing a bachelorâ€™s degree in science, engineering, math, computer science, or other technical discipline.

 

Qualifications:

Our co-op program begins on September 20, 2021 and ends on March 25, 2022.

 

AVIAN is a service-based organization. As an equal opportunity employer, our policy of business is to seek the most qualified candidate for each talent opportunity without regard to race, creed, color, sex, age, religious belief, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sexual preference, physical or mental handicap, lawful political affiliation, or veteranâ€™s status.

Description


Humana Inc., is a health and well-being company based out of Louisville, KY. We started out as a nursing home company back in 1961...who knew that decades later we would be listed as a Fortune 500 company for 25 years! Today we are home to 50,000+ employees who help to serve our 14.2 million members on a daily basis. Together we are dedicated to helping both our members and employees in becoming the healthiest version of themselves - covering all ends of the spectrum from physical health to mental health. This past year, we have been ranked on the best places to work in IT by Computer World and placed on both Forbes' lists of Best Employers for Diversity and America's Best Employers for New Grads!


While we may be well known for our efforts in the insurance space, Humana is a tech company at its core. We would not be able to function the way we do today without the solutions, support, and analytical insights provided by our IT organization! We are currently seeking interns who are interested in joining our team and bringing fresh new perspectives to the world of health using technology as a conduit.

Responsibilities


The Basics:


A key ingredient to our program's success has revolved around our dedication to our internship being a developmental program - meaning you do not need to know everything when you join the IT team as an intern! We are here to help teach and guide you along the way by providing learning sessions, resources, and workshops. You will have a safe space to learn and be given autonomy to bring your creative solutions to very real problems. Interns are also provided multiple opportunities for networking throughout the summer! One networking event in particular that is back by popular demand are the coffee chats that we host with anyone and everyone from directors up to our CIO! On top of that, you will be exposed to the latest technologies and best practices within a Fortune 500 company. The solutions developed by past and current interns are accessible to over 50,000+ Humana associates, which means no 'coffee run' projects here - only meaningful work!


Enterprise Information Protection (EIP) has a mission to inspire trust and enable growth for Humana. The program is chartered to protect information assets by maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Humana's information that fuels the delivered experience for Humana's associates and members. We enable business while ensuring compliance, achieving high industry standards, and effectively prioritizing threat management to protect the organization. As an intern in EIP you will have the opportunity to work with cyber security specialists and learn how Humana protects user and member data against cyber threats and hackers. Past interns have helped to define and implement security controls, worked with security technology and have supported security operations and risk management.


We have several areas with Internship opportunities for next summer. Read below to find the best fit for you and your career goals!


Strategy and Enablement


+ Oversees EIP's strategic priority to deliver a contemporary and frictionless cybersecurity experience for our employees and members, while strengthening our cyber maturity and preparing for technology modernization and enterprise cloud migration. This includes Talent Management, Budget/Finance, Portfolio/Project Management as well as Training and Awareness


Architecture, Engineering, Innovation, and Cyber Risk Management


+ Oversees and innovates security architecture, mitigates cyber risks, provides governance and policy and compliance oversight, establishes controls and ensures proper control implementation with assurance. Drives the strategy, design, and performance of security technology and solutions, service enablement, and automation; drives an end-to-end cyber risk lifecycle capability across the enterprise in a unified cyber risk management function.


Cyber Security Operations Center


+ 24X7 Cyber Security and Counter Threat Operations by monitoring, detection and response to cyber events and incidents and for leading proactive threat management, data security and vulnerability/config management efforts by leveraging analytics to develop insights and detection capabilities.


Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI)


+ Oversees and analyzes situational awareness related to threat and threat actors and provide cyber threat and cyber threat landscape warnings by consuming and generating intelligence in three areas - tactical, operational, and strategic - while performing research, analysis and external collaboration.


Identity and Access Management (IAM)


+ Oversees processes and technologies to connect Humana's internal and external users with the information, applications and data they need every day. Simply put, Identity and Access Management works to ensure that the right users have the right access at the right time to the right resources for the right reasons.


Cyber Business Alignment


+ Oversees and integrates the company's cyber and information protection strategy into the business strategy and execution, and serve as a liaison between Humana's information security organization and Humana's lines of business. Responds to client cyber inquiries as our segments bring in new business for Humana and is accountable for the cyber governance of new acquisitions and joint ventures as they integrate with Humana's.


Although there is no need to choose a certain path now, you are more than welcome to share your preference with your college programs recruiter (sharing your preference does not guarantee placement in a given space.)


What's in it for you?


+ Collaborate with experienced professionals + past tech interns

+ Gain real world experience along with industry, business, and technical knowledge

+ Network with Humana's leaders

+ Competitive summer pay

+ Paid Housing (if internship is not virtual)

+ Opportunities for Advanced (juniors and below) offers after successful completion of Entry Program

+ Part-time opportunities working remotely from school

+ Full-time opportunities exist for upcoming graduates in the form of a competitive rotational Early Career Experience designed to allow the participant to build out their program the best way for their career path , while also consuming necessary knowledge to excel in Cyber Security and Humana

+ Fun social and networking events all summer long

+ Engaging virtual learning experience


Must-Haves:


+ Available to work full-time for the FULL 12 Weeks of the program (late May to early August)

+ Be a current student (3- 6 minimum credit hours) pursuing a degree related to the technology field (Computer Science, Information Systems, Informatics, Management Information Systems, etc)

+ Have a curiosity + passion for learning

+ Display self-motivation + initiative balanced with a collaborative attitude

+ Work Eligibility: Humana does not provide visa sponsorship or OPT/CPT for our summer internship. For example, this would mean you are either a U.S. citizen, a Lawful Permanent Resident, or in Refugee or Asylee status and do not require visa sponsorship to be eligible


Nice-to-Haves:


+ Previous internship and/or work experience

+ Actively involved on-campus and/or in your community

+ Interest or experience specifically in cyber security and information protection

+ Strong interest in health and well-being with a passion for helping others 

+ Overall GPA of 3.0 or higher


Scheduled Weekly Hours


40

Rec Room is a virtual social club where you play and create games with friends. Our mission is to ensure that Rec Room is a fun and welcoming environment for people from all walks of life. We are building games, user-generated content, and tools that allow our players to make their own games, spaces, and sell their creations across multiple platforms (mobile, console, VR).  

We are hiring Seniors Undergrads or Final Year Masters Students for Internships in 2021 & 2022 (with the potential for full-time offers at the end). These are paid internships where you will be embedded on a development team and work directly on features for Rec Room. To be eligible, you must be available for full-time work during our core hours in Pacific Time. 

WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON: 

  • Build the tools that allow creators to sell wares via the in-game economy 
  • Design and build creative tools that players use to collaboratively build within Rec Room
  • Proactively prototype new ideas and solutions 
  • Use metrics to track feature performance and inform design decisions
  • Build robust systems and tools that can stand up to malicious actors
  • Contribute creatively to the game and economy design process
  • Work on a wide variety of features and systems cross collaboratively with other teams as needed  

 REQUIREMENTS: 

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience
  • Experience in games or a closely-related field (school projects or small/indie games are great) 
  • Experience using and/or familiarity with Unity, Unreal, or a similar game engine
  • Fluency in C#
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-moving, ambiguous development environment
  • A constant desire to learn, improve, and help others improve
  • Ability to relocate to Seattle, WA (once we can be in the office again) 

 BONUS POINTS 

  • Strong interaction design & implementation skills
  • Experience with live services and rapid-deployment
  • Experience with metrics/telemetry
  • Experience with and passion for in-game economies
  • Experience with and passion for User Generated Content 
  • Experience with and passion for design
  • Ability to convert full time at the end of the internship 

COMPANY INFO TO KNOW:  

Rec Room offers generous medical, dental, and vision plans that cover you, your spouse/domestic partner, and children. We also support your retirement benefits with a company match. Rec Room values work-life balance by providing unlimited paid time off. Our company values are real and drive our culture. We work hard to ensure be a safe and friendly place for people from all walks of life. 

Rec Room provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

JBS USA is a leading global provider of diversified, high-quality food products, including a portfolio of well-recognized brands and innovative, easy-to-use food solutions. We process, prepare, package and deliver fresh and value-added premium meat, poultry and retail-ready food products for customers in approximately 100 countries on six continents. We are also the majority shareholder of Pilgrim’s, the largest poultry company in North America. JBS USA employs more than 100,000 team members, and our corporate office is located in beautiful Greeley, Colorado, where our 1,200 team members onsite enjoy more than 300 days of sunshine a year.  

JBS is seeking candidates for a part-time Data Science Intern as part of the IT Career Development role at our Corporate Office in Greeley, CO. The intent of this position is to provide a year-round, entry-level position to currently enrolled college students on our IT team. This is an exciting, year-round opportunity for candidates who excel in a busy, achievement-oriented environment and obtain relevant work experience that can lead to long-term placement with JBS. School credit may be available.  

Responsibilities will vary based on the role but may include:  

  • Leveraging and sharing the latest machine and deep learning techniques to challenge the current practices across the business units  
  • Developing POC (Proof of Concept) projects applying machine learning methods including Deep Learning, Computer Vision, and related algorithms.  
  • Provide clear and accurate guidance to internal stakeholders regarding how to successfully adopt and implement technological solutions into their environment   
  • Maintain documentation and training material for supported services   
  • Communicate highly technical information to both technical and non-technical personnel   
  • Participation in process improvement discussions and meetings   
  • Provide support to user groups after a project and obtain feedback to be used as catalyst to optimize the system further  
  • Other duties as assigned 

Qualifications:    

  • Preferred availability is 20 -30 hours per week (must be within the hours of Monday-Friday 7am-5pm), year-round   
  • Actively pursuing a bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science or related fields.  
  • Experience in Data science and Machine Learning.  
  • Proficient in Python and SQL.  
  • Experience is working on cloud environments like AWS, GCP is preferred.  
  • Self-motivated   
  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely with internal and external customers   
  • Ability to multi-task and strong work ethic   
  • Ability to successfully work under strict deadlines   
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills   
  • Problem solving and analytical mindset  

The applicant who fills this position will be eligible for the following compensation and benefits:  

  • Base salary of $20.00 per hour

Responsibilities for this Position:

REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES AND TASKS:

 

Apply your classroom-learned skills to a program supporting the defense of our country. GDMS has an immediate opening for a Mechanical Engineering Intern to join our team. The position provides an opportunity to work on projects that support some of our nationâ€™s fundamental defense services. GDMS employees work closely with esteemed customers to develop solutions that allow them to carry out high-stakes national security missions.

position: 2022 Atlanta Summer Internship Program - Technology Solutions Services (Application Delivery Services)
description:
Company

Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta

OUR BANK - The Federal Reserve is the central bank of the United States and is one of the most influential, trusted, and prestigious financial organizations. It consists of twelve Reserve Banks located around the country and the Board of Governors in Washington, D.C. The Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta territory covers the Sixth Federal Reserve District, which includes Alabama, Florida, and Georgia, and portions of Louisiana, Mississippi, and Tennessee. The Atlanta Fed and the other Reserve Banks play an important part in all three of the Fed's functions: monetary policy, bank supervision and regulation, and the operation of a nationwide payment system.

OUR PEOPLE - At the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta, we embrace diversity and inclusion as essential to who we are. We rely on the unique individual talents, expertise, and valued perspectives of our employees as well as those of external stakeholders to carry out our mission as part of the nation's central bank.

A requirement of this position is that the employee must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or qualify for an accommodation from the Bank’s vaccination policy. To provide for the health and safety of its employees and support the Bank’s mission to the greatest extent possible, the Bank decided to adopt this requirement after careful review of public health information, workforce data, employee feedback, and the Federal Reserve System’s pandemic recovery plans. The Bank requires all employees to be vaccinated fully against COVID-19 as a condition of employment.

ABOUT OUR TEAM – TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS SERVICES - The Technology Solutions Services department’s mission is to deliver innovative, high quality, and cost-effective technology solutions and services in partnership with clients. We provide the Sixth District with support for workstations, mobile devices, network connectivity, telephony services, application development services, hardware/software purchasing, and audio-visual support.

YOUR JOB - Under supervision, the select intern will work with staff on technology related projects either for existing areas managed by the group or Research & Development (R&D) related areas such as AI, Machine Learning, Business Intelligence/Data Analytics, Data Visualization. The intern may also work with current staff on projects or in the R&D space performing Point of Contact or pilots for new technology areas.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must have an interest in Technology Solution Services.
  • Applicants who have graduation dates of December 2022 & May 2023 are eligible to apply.
  • Students must be currently enrolled at an accredited college or university in a Bachelor or Graduate degree program through the duration of the internship.
  • Minimum cumulative GPA above 2.75 in academically rigorous curriculum.
  • Must be committed to working a 40-hour work week for 10-12 weeks during the summer months.
  • Preferred majors include: Computer Science, Information Systems Management, or related programs.  

CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Preferred Programming Languages: C# or Java. Python and SQL Database knowledge a plus.
  • Experience with Tableau, Microsoft PowerBI, SharePoint, or related software
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Ability to work independently and take ownership of projects
  • Great work ethic and detail oriented

OUR BENEFITS TO INTERNS (some benefits are subject to being onsite):

  • Professional development opportunities
  • Networking
  • MARTA passes provided
  • Free LinkedIn Learning access
  • Free access to our FedFuel career development tool
  • Café and dining options on-site
  • Dress for your day
  • Flexible hours
  • Access to on-site fitness center

TO APPLY:

In addition to your application, please attach a resume and a copy of your most recent unofficial transcript.

PLEASE READ:

Internships are paid. Summer housing will not be provided. Privacy Notice

Stellantis' College Intern Program offers a unique opportunity for highly motivated, innovative, and inspired individuals to work in a challenging assignment where contribution, teamwork, and communication are vital to the success of the organization. As a leading-edge company, we can provide real world challenges and rewarding intern experiences to candidates from a variety of colleges and universities while providing candidate a competitive salary.

Interns are assigned to an organization department based on the candidate's background, skill set and interests. The assignments are project-oriented, meaningful to the department and allow the intern to take responsibility for a major task. Interns experience a sense of personal accomplishment and contribution and experience the corporate business culture through work assignments and structured activities. They gain the communication and etiquette skills required in business while sharing knowledge gained from recent courses. They also enhance their computer skills and learn new systems and software. Each intern assignment consists of challenging projects with specific goals, providing opportunities for personal growth and development. Interns that demonstrate outstanding qualities may be invited back the following year for a second internship or to interview for full-time positions in our various new hire programs.

Summer internships are primarily located at the Stellantis US Headquarters and Technology Center in Auburn Hills, Michigan, other facilities in the Detroit Metropolitan area, and Business Centers located throughout the country. Interns may qualify for a housing allowance and/or travel assistance. During the internship, interns will have the opportunity to participate in many activities designed specifically to enhance their knowledge of Stellantis, our products and the metro Detroit area.

The Portfolio Planning organization at Stellantis is responsible for setting the North America Long Range Vehicle Product Plan, leveraging data analytics tools to provide insights into the automotive market, and performing consumer research to inspire new products and experiences through an understanding of human needs and attitudes. These teams within the Portfolio Planning organization are highly strategic and require "out of the box" thinking to plan for the company's future. The Portfolio Planning intern will participate in the evaluation of market trends as well as analysis of customer interest and competition to find the company's next opportunity. The intern will also support aspects within the research process from helping to design, execute and analyze consumer research. The intern will transform the data and observations into insight, implications and recommendations to help drive strategic decisions.



 

Basic Qualifications: 

 
* Completion of sophomore year at an accredited university by summer of 2022 
* Currently pursuing a degree in Marketing Science, Social Sciences, Business Marketing, or related field 

Preferred Qualifications: 

 
* Strong interest in automotive industry 
* Demonstrated critical thinking and problem solving skills 
* Strong written and oral communication skills 
* Good interpersonal skills 
* Ability to work in a team environment 
* Computer proficient (including spreadsheet, word processing and database applications) 
* Creative / resourceful information mining and fact seeking skills 
* Advanced analytical and PowerPoint presentation building skills 
* GPA of 3.0 or higher (based on a 4.0 scale) 
* Previous automotive internships/experience 

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled
